column2: Brief Role :   Job Description      Adherence to Spare management.	 Monitoring of energy consumptions & comparison wrt baseline.	 Implementing energy saving schemes for continuous reduction in energy consumptions.	  Ensure operation and maintenance activities are executed as per approved engineering practices.	 Conduct self  /  departmental audits for availability of Spares  /  Consumables  /  Tools for HVAC , PHE ,  FDP.	  Ensure Terminals Mechanical Safety ,  Regulations / Legal compliances.	 Ensure proper O&M of Smoke Fans ( Fire related devices)  -  Exhaust ,  Pressurizations ,  Jet fans , Fire alarm etc.	  Ensure proper use of Scaffoldings / Tools / Tackles & work - permits including hot - work permits	  Ensure proper disposal of Grease Traps / Soil wastages & its SOPs in conjunction with Environment.	  Ensure timely removal of greases in Grease pits to restrict choking of pits / line leakages etc.	 Ensure proper cleanliness of Apron RO / Coolers.	 Restrict leakages wrt taps ( due to damages ,  etc.) & its surrounding area cleaning through Airside / housekeeping.	  Experience in the Building Construction Industry preferably large infrastructure Buildings ,  Airports ,  Metros , etc.	  Review & execution of HVAC / PHE / FDP services and related electro mechanical and other MEP Services for assigned project.	 Perform all other duties as assigned and required. column2: We are seeking a highly experienced HVAC Design Manager. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 10-15 years of hands-on experience in HVAC system design. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the success of various kinds of HVAC systems across the sectors by leading and executing HVAC design efforts. Role & responsibilities     1.  HVAC System Design:  Lead the design and development of HVAC systems with all designs are compliant with relevant codes, standards, and regulations. 2.  Technical Expertise:  Apply deep knowledge of HVAC engineering principles and practices to provide innovative and efficient HVAC design solutions. 3.  Project Leadership:  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration of HVAC systems. 4.  Feasibility Studies:  Participate in feasibility studies to evaluate HVAC system requirements and provide expert insights to guide project decision-making. 5.  Equipment Selection:  Select appropriate HVAC equipment, components, and materials based on project requirements, performance criteria, and cost-effectiveness. 6.  Simulation and Analysis:  Utilize advanced HVAC simulation tools and software to perform system analysis, energy modeling, and thermal load calculations to optimize HVAC system performance. 7.  Quality Assurance:  Oversee the review and approval of HVAC design deliverables, including drawings, specifications, and calculations, to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements. 8.  Client Interaction:  Act as a technical point of contact for clients, addressing their questions, concerns, and feedback related to HVAC design aspects of power plant projects. 9.  Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and challenges related to HVAC design, develop mitigation strategies, and ensure that all design solutions are aligned with safety and environmental standards. Preferred candidate profile     1. bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or related field. Master's degree is a plus. 2. 10-15 years of progressive experience in HVAC system design 3. Professional Engineer (PE) licensure is preferred. 4. Proficiency in HVAC design software and simulation tools (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit, TRACE 700, etc.). 5. Thorough understanding of relevant codes and standards (ASHRAE, NFPA, etc.). 6. Strong project management skills and experience leading cross-functional teams. 7. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders. 8. Demonstrated track record of successful HVAC system design implementations within power plant projects. 9. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. 10. Commitment to staying updated with industry trends and advancements in HVAC technology. Perks and benefits   More than the Industry Bench Mark

column2: As member of TK-NCA Erection & Commissioning Hub, the Site Mechanical Supervisor, following would be your roles and responsibilities:        You will be in charge to oversee and lead the installation of          In the Office or WFH: : Review site project work package: SoW, Site Instructions, Installation manuals, Risks Analysis & Safety plans ensuring all works are in line with the company standards and Client specification.          Study project documentation, prepare detail report about changes made on site and cooperate to the engineering offices.          Define, in conjunction with Project Manager and Commissioning Manager the Erection strategy and the associated schedule ensuring they adhere to contractual requirements          At Site : Support Clients with identification of delivered material/equipment and advise the correct handling for schedule optimization. Report any shortage or deviation on the packing list.          Inspect and evaluate status of civil works prior to commence TK-NCA plants erection.          Oversee the mechanical engineering aspects of the installed equipment & Instruments, ensuring compliance with design specifications, industry regulations, and safety standards.          Proactively identify potential issues in the mechanical system installation or equipment/Instruments, and promptly report them to the appropriate stakeholders.          Work closely with the project team to develop effective solutions and ensure timely resolution of problems.          Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements, safety protocols, and company policies pertaining to mechanical installations and construction.          Prepare regular progress & technical reports, maintain accurate documentation, and update relevant records related to Installation activities.          Implement and enforce strict quality control measures to maintain the highest standards of workmanship in all mechanical activities on the site.          Ensure safety throughout all plant erection phase (open the work permit, if applicable, and promote risk assessment within NCA team);          Be the focal point and representative of NCA on site towards client , during Mechanical Erection phase of the plant till MC (Mechanical Completion)          Lead and direct all Erection activities in scope coordinating NCA team members (Civil, Mechanical, E&I) and Vendors, to achieve the plant Mechanical Completion          Responsible to ensure proper documentation and reporting of related activities (Progress reports, Punch List, Materials Certificates, etc.);          Be involved and participate in client, vendor, and/or subcontractor meetings to resolve issues;          Previous experience in closely related position from 10 years        Rights/Authorities        Instruct the NCA / Subcontractor s team members;          Take decision on daily basis to guarantee a smooth erection process;          In coordination with the Project Management, negotiate and agree with the client on any change related to Installation topics;          Mobilize, demobilizes and replace the NCA Installation team members according to site and progress requirements;          Resolve technical issues or disputes, if in the interest of overall project management or the decision violates contractual, safety or quality requirements.              Your profile            The ideal candidate must satisfy the following requirements :          Strong mechanical background, Basic education qualification is : Completed university studies as a associate degree/graduate engineer or comparable degree (preferably Mechanical Engineer)      Previous experience in closely related position from 10 years minimum of specific experience as Supervisor in Construction, Oil & Gas or Chemical industry, Power Plants (Experience in Electrolysis will be a plus);      Previous experience managing work crews and teams with a blend of different cultures and nationalities is considered as a plus      Demonstrated ability to interface with the client to understand requirements and providing technical insight and advice on a wide range of project areas (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical & Instrumentation).      Fluent in English both verbal and written (German, Italian or/and other European languages are a plus);      Availability to travel on prolonged stay at site in India & abroad (focus Middle-East, US and Europe);      High attention to HSE topics and procedures;      Capability to manage stressful situations;      Practical approach with troubleshooting and problem solving;      Knowledge of the IT tools: MS Office, Design softwares (i.e. AutoCAD, Navisworks, etc.), MS Project.                          Your benefits          Electrolysis Green Hydrogen & Chlor Alkali Technology Provider for a livable planet.    Working on Global clients.    You will be part of new establishment for upcoming generation.    Company believes in Innovation and Employee Empowerment.    Excellent work culture

column2: Job Description: Mechanical Designer (Static Equipment) We are seeking a skilled Mechanical Designer specializing in the preparation of detailed equipment fabrication drawings using AutoCAD, with a focus on static equipment design. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in drafting and drawing standards, particularly in the Oil & Gas (O&G) and refinery sectors. Key Responsibilities: Develop detailed fabrication drawings and designs for static equipment in accordance with project specifications and industry standards. Ensure accuracy, completeness, and adherence to drafting and drawing standards. Utilize AutoCAD proficiently to create drawings, including symbols, dimensions, welding details, cross-sectional views, and geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T). Collaborate with engineers and project teams to understand design requirements and specifications. Review and interpret technical drawings, sketches, and specifications to create accurate and clear drawings. Provide support for static equipment drafting and detailing tasks, including equipment layout drawings and assembly drawings. Required Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field, or equivalent work experience. Minimum 6-8 years of experience in mechanical design and drafting, with a focus on static equipment. Expertise in AutoCAD software; experience with Autodesk Inventor is preferred. In-depth knowledge of drafting standards and practices, particularly related to O&G and refinery industries. Proficiency in interpreting engineering drawings, including symbols, dimensions, and GD&T. Strong understanding of welding details, material specifications, and fabrication processes. Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team, with excellent communication and collaboration skills. Familiarity with industry codes and standards such as ASME, API, and ANSI. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with 3D modeling software for equipment design and layout. Familiarity with project management processes and documentation. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
column11: Autodesk Inventor, AutoCAD, Static Equipment Design, Pressure Vessels

column2: The Mechanical Engineer applies their conceptual knowledge of mechanicals and with a moderate level of guidance and direction from colleagues and leadership, is responsible for solving a range of straightforward mechanical problems. column2: Role & responsibilities  :    Designing and Developing Mechanical Systems : Mechanical engineers often design and develop mechanical systems, products, or components. This could involve creating detailed CAD models, performing engineering calculations, and selecting appropriate materials and manufacturing processes. Analyzing and Testing Prototypes : Mechanical engineers may be responsible for analyzing and testing prototypes to ensure they meet design specifications and performance requirements. This could involve conducting simulations, laboratory testing, or field testing. Improving Existing Systems : Mechanical engineers often work on improving existing mechanical systems or processes to enhance efficiency, reliability, or performance. This could involve troubleshooting issues, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing design changes or upgrades. Project Management : Mechanical engineers may be involved in project management, including planning, scheduling, and coordinating engineering projects. This could involve working with cross-functional teams, managing budgets and resources, and ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget. Collaborating with Cross-Functional Teams : Mechanical engineers often collaborate with other engineering disciplines, such as electrical engineers, civil engineers, and software engineers, as well as with professionals from other departments, such as manufacturing, quality assurance, and procurement. Compliance with Regulations and Standards : Mechanical engineers are often responsible for ensuring that their designs and products comply with relevant regulations, codes, and standards. This could involve staying up-to-date with industry regulations, performing risk assessments, and conducting compliance testing. Documentation and Reporting : Mechanical engineers are typically responsible for creating and maintaining documentation related to their projects, including design documentation, technical specifications, test reports, and project reports. Continuous Learning and Professional Development : Mechanical engineers are expected to stay current with advancements in their field, including new technologies, tools, and techniques. This may involve attending training sessions, workshops, or conferences, as well as pursuing further education or professional certifications. Preferred candidate profile  :      Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineer   Perks and benefits  : Health Insurance:   We provide comprehensive health insurance coverage, including medical, dental, and vision plans, to ensure the well-being of employees and their families. Competitive Salary:   Offer a salary package that is competitive within the industry and reflects the candidate's skills, experience, and qualifications. Paid Time Off:   Provide generous vacation, sick leave, and holiday pay to allow employees to rest, recharge, and spend time with their loved ones.

Registered Professional Mechanical Engineer.          10+ years of experience with mission critical or high-tech industry projects. column2: As a Mechanical Engineer at Xyug Technologies Pvt Ltd, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining mechanical systems and components to meet the company's technical and business objectives.      Your responsibilities will include:      **1. Mechanical Design and Analysis:**    - Develop and design mechanical systems, components, and products using CAD software and other engineering tools.    - Conduct feasibility studies and analyze design options to optimize performance, cost, and reliability.    - Perform stress analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), and other simulations to ensure product integrity.      **2. Prototyping and Testing:**    - Create prototypes and test units to validate design concepts and assess performance.    - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct product testing, troubleshoot issues, and make necessary design modifications.      **3. Documentation and Reporting:**    - Prepare detailed engineering documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports.    - Keep accurate records of project progress and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders.      **4. Research and Development:**    - Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices.    - Contribute to the development of new products and improvements to existing ones through research and innovation.      **Qualifications:**      - Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field (Master's degree preferred).    - Professional Engineering (PE) license is a plus.    - 2+ years of experience in mechanical engineering or a related role.    - Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) and other engineering tools.    - Strong knowledge of mechanical design principles, materials, and manufacturing processes.    - Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.    - Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.    - Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.    - Strong project management skills.

column2: Job Title: Mechanical Engineer - Gas Pipeline/LPG Field Company: Techno Global Services Location: Noida, Uttar Pradesh Overview: Techno Global Services, a leading provider of engineering solutions in the field of gas pipelines and LPG systems, is seeking a skilled Mechanical Engineer with 3 to 5 years of relevant experience. Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain gas pipeline systems and LPG facilities ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Conduct feasibility studies, risk assessments, and technical evaluations for gas pipeline projects. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including project managers, architects, and contractors to ensure project objectives are met within specified timelines and budget constraints. Perform site inspections, troubleshoot technical issues, and provide innovative solutions to optimize pipeline performance and efficiency. Prepare detailed engineering drawings, specifications, and documentation for gas pipeline construction and maintenance projects. Conduct regular inspections and audits to ensure adherence to safety protocols and regulatory requirements. Provide technical support and guidance to junior engineers and project team members as needed. Stay updated on emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in the gas pipeline and LPG industry to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Strong technical knowledge and understanding of gas pipeline engineering principles, codes, and standards (e.g., ASME, API, ANSI). Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks) for drafting and design purposes. Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with internal teams, clients, and stakeholders. Proven problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex issues and implement effective solutions. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Knowledge of safety regulations and procedures related to gas pipeline operations and maintenance. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Professional Engineer (PE) license. Experience working with government agencies and regulatory bodies involved in gas pipeline projects. Previous experience in project management or leadership roles. column2: At Visteon, the work we do is both relevant and recognized  not just by our organization, but by our peers, by industry-leading brands, and by millions of drivers around the world.  Thats YOUR work . And,  as a truly global technology leader in the mobility space , focused on building cross-functional AND cross-cultural teams, we connect you with people who help you grow. So here, whatever we do is not a job. Its a mission . As a multi-billion-dollar leader of disruptive change in the industry, we are shaping the future, while enabling a cleaner environment. No other industry offers more fast-paced change and opportunity. We are in the midst of a mobility revolution that will completely change the way we interact with our vehicles, reduce the number of car accidents and fatalities, and make the world a cleaner place.    Visteon is at the epicenter of this mobility revolution.  Two major trends in the automotive industry  the shift to electric vehicles and vehicles with autonomous safety technologies  have created unique opportunities for Visteon. We are the only automotive provider  focused exclusively on cockpit electronics  the fastest-growing segment in the industry .    And our team is ready for YOU. To show the world what you can do.   Detailed description: Key Objectives of this Role:  Mechanical design and development of cockpit electronics, Electrification products for the automotive industry.  Mechanical support of the products and productions - release, changes, etc.  Building and/or updating CAD models and drawings of the parts and products.  Project management and process compliance activities.  Communication and coordinate with relevant stakeholders  Qualification, Experience and Skills:  Bachelor's degree in the field of mechanical engineering or related  7~10 years of industry experience in relevant products  3D models design  parts and assemblies (CAD Tool  CATIA V5);  2D drawings preparation (CAD Tool  CATIA V5)  Tolerance stack-up  GD&T (Geometrical Dimensioning and Tolerancing)  Feasibility studies.  DFMEA (Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis)  ME Project management activities  Visteon process compliance  Customer and supplier communication  Fluent in verbal and written English More Good Reasons to Work for Visteon Focusing on the Future Our company strategy focuses on leading the evolution of automotive digital cockpits and safety solutions. This strategy is driven by constant innovation, and you will support our efforts through your role. We are recognized across the industry for innovation. We have a strong book of business that is expected to drive future growth, along with a customer base that includes almost every automotive manufacturer in the world. Company Culture Working at Visteon is a journey in which our employees can develop their strengths and advance their careers while making a difference globally. Join us and help change the world and how we interact with our vehicles. Visteon is where the best technical talent creates the future. Learn more about our culture here. Competitive Compensation and Benefits Visteon offers competitive salaries and benefits and an environment that encourages employees to achieve their career goals. About Visteon Visteon is a global technology company serving the mobility industry, dedicated to creating a more enjoyable, connected and safe driving experience. The company?? platforms leverage proven, scalable hardware and software solutions that enable the digital, electric, and autonomous evolution of our global automotive customers. Visteon products align with key industry trends and include digital instrument clusters, displays, Android-based infotainment systems, domain controllers, advanced driver assistance systems and electrification. The company, headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, recorded approximately $3.76 billion in annual sales and booked $6 billion of new business in 2022.   Follow Us For more information about our company, technologies and products, follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. You can also follow our careers-focused channels on Twitter and Facebook to keep up with our latest job postings and the great work our employees are doing. If interested in this opportunity, kindly share your updated resume along with following details. Total Experience: Current CTC: Expected CTC: Notice Period:? Current Location: Preferred Location:

Utilize CAD tools such as Fusion360, SolidWorks, and Ansys for detailed design and simulation.       - Create accurate 3D models and engineering drawings to support the prototyping process.           3. **Simulation:**         - Conduct simulations to analyze and optimize the performance of robotic mechanisms.       - Work on improving efficiency, accuracy, and durability through simulation tools.           4. **Prototyping:**         - Actively engage in hands-on prototyping activities to bring concepts to life.       - Collaborate with the fabrication team to build and test prototypes.           5. **Manufacturing Knowledge:**         - Apply knowledge of manufacturing processes such as CNC machining, 3D printing, and other relevant techniques.       - Optimize designs for manufacturability and cost-effectiveness.           6. **Mobile Robots and Drive Train Experience:**         - Previous experience in the design of mobile robots, chassis, and drive trains is highly desirable.           7. **Immediate Availability:**         - The candidate should be able to join the team immediately.         8. **URFD(unified robot description format) creation for Ros**                 Qualifications:           - Bachelors or masters degree in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, or a related field.       - Proficiency in CAD design, specifically with tools such as Fusion360, SolidWorks, and Ansys.       - Hands-on experience with prototyping and a strong understanding of manufacturing processes.       - Familiarity with CNC machining, 3D printing, and other fabrication techniques.       - Knowledge of ROS is a plus.       - Experience in the design of mobile robots, chassis, and drive trains is preferred.       - Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and convey   complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.  Prior experience in BIM-related projects.  Proven track record of successfully developing and executing scripts.

column2: SSOE is seeking a  Senior Process Mechanical Engineer(Process Piping and Equipment)  with a primary focus on thermal stress analysis utilizing Caesar II software. A strong knowledge of piping codes including ASME B31.1, ASME B31.3 and seismic impact is required. You will be challenged with leading a small team located in Mumbai and coordinating with the United States teams. Providing oversight and training to junior staff are also expectations.  Experience leading an engineering design team from preliminary engineering through construction is a plus. Required skills include the development, completion of engineering calculations, equipment sizing, selection, preparation of equipment and construction specifications.  Coordination with multi-discipline engineering and design teams is needed to deliver design and construction deliverables Role & responsibilities: Strong knowledge of piping codes including ASME B31.1, ASME B31.3 and seismic impact is required Be the main contact for thermal stress analysis requests from the United States engineering teams. Coordinate completion of the stress analysis utilizing Caesar II with the Mumbai based team. Communicate regularly with the Unites States engineering team to resolve piping system design / stress issues. Mentor / train the Mumbai stress analysis team. Lead a small team located in Mumbai and coordinating with the United States teams Responsible for quality, budget, and schedule adherence If the stress analysis work is not needed, providing support to an engineering design team will be a secondary role. Tasks could include: Completing engineering studies, writing reports, developing and completion of engineering calculations. Prepare designs for plant installations, coordinate with design/drafting staff, and prepare equipment and construction specifications. Specifications will include major items of rotating equipment such as boilers, compressors, turbines, and pumps. Other equipment will include pressure vessels, heat exchangers, and other manufacturing equipment. PFD and P&ID development. Coordination with multi-discipline engineering and design teams is needed to deliver design and construction deliverables. Preferred candidate profile:   Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering (Full-time) Familiarity with ASME process piping codes B31.1 & B31.3 & similar required.  Experience with Caesar II stress analysis software is required. Must have good writing and verbal communication skills. Should be ready to work for a couple of hours in the evening to coordinate with international teams. Candidates should have a minimum of 10-15 years of relevant experience. Interested candidates please share updated resume with below details at mbhalerao@ssoe.com:   Total exp:  Location: Notice period:  Current salary:  Expected salary:  Reason for change:  Communication skills:  Key skills:

column2: SSOE works with the worlds leading high-tech companies to power technology at our fingertips from smart phones to smart cards and meet the ongoing global chip demand. Were looking to hire a Piping designer to our team, who will have the opportunity to participate in the design of state-of-the-art industrial and high-tech manufacturing facilities. Our Piping Designers will be responsible for working with other contributing design teams, and Sr. Project Managers to create and problem-solve exciting and complex designs that incorporate some of the latest design techniques, while ensuring that all specifications are met, and to ensure timely completion of projects. The following duties are typical of the position but are not all encompassing. Responsibilities include those required to deliver quality service on schedule and within budget in a team environment. Analyzes sketches, notes and other input materials to determine and plan the best approach to prepare drawings. Develops the design and drafting of complex piping drawings given basic information such as P&ID's, GA's, piping specifications, equipment arrangement drawings. Aware of Process piping code ASME31.3 and ASTM etc. Extensively Supporting the Spooling Team for Spooling of Process piping includes Water, Gas, Air, Waste etc. Coordinate with Piping Engineering Team and other design disciplines to resolve issues. Should know about basics of various equipment & piping around the equipment. Able to extract reports from the modeling software. Review and check bill of material reports extracted from models. Assist in checking when required. Working knowledge of Piping & Instrument Diagrams (P&ID) symbiology. Ability to work independently and produce presentation level quality of deliverables minimal supervision. May have minimal external customer contact. Applies design fundamentals to total systems or sub-systems Solves design problems, but is expected to need assistance.   Diploma in Mechanical Engineering  Minimum 2 years to 5 years related designer experience with former employer(s). Proficiency in the use of Revit for drafting, Spooling for process piping, Navisworks for Model review and Coordination, mechanical equipment modelling in Revit for process piping industry and design applications required. AUTOCAD and any other drafting or modelling software knowledge is required. Should be able to work for four hours during late evening to coordinate with the international offices.  Hybrid work environment (two days work from office and three days work from home).

column2: Mechanical site engineers, also known as field engineers, are responsible for making sure all machinery on a given project is constructed and installed correctly. Usually, these projects are commercial construction projects and involve HVAC systems. Mechanical site engineers can also find employment in the medical and manufacturing industries, as both of these industries require a lot of machinery. Mechanical site engineers spend a majority of their shift on the site of their current project. They are the engineers responsible for bringing the plans outlined in blueprints to life. This role is a full-time position that usually includes weekends off.       Mechanical site engineers delegate tasks to laborers, plumbers, masons, and lower-level engineering technicians. Since some projects are completed outdoors, mechanical site engineers have to prepare for the elements.     Mechanical Site Engineer Duties and Responsibilities     A mechanical site engineers duties and responsibilities vary slightly depending on the industry. We analyzed mechanical site engineer job descriptions to come up with the following list of core duties and responsibilities:         Analyze and Interpret Project Blueprints         Mechanical site engineers dont have to create blueprints often, but they do have to interpret blueprints created by CAD software on a daily basis. They can conceptualize which tasks need to be done in which order to make the blueprint a reality.         Facilitate Construction and Installation of Machine Components         While they don t do much of the actual building themselves, mechanical site engineers are heavily involved in the construction and installation of machine components. This can mean creating machinery from scratch or installing a component as part of a repair.         Test Machine Components for Functionality         Depending on one s industry, there are specific tests for each kind of machinery. It is the responsibility of the mechanical site engineer to run these tests before signing off on completion. If something doesn t perform as expected, he or she is responsible for diagnosing and fixing the problem.         Delegate Tasks to Various Project Employees         Mechanical site engineers are part project manager; they delegate tasks to laborers and technicians, providing guidance as these workers complete their tasks.         Ensure Project is Completed on Time and Budget         Project stakeholders hate when a project costs more time or money than was originally estimated. It is up to the mechanical site engineer to make sure all the mechanical aspects of the project are completed as efficiently as possible.
column11: HVAC, Construction, Mechanical, CAD, Conceptualization, Budgeting, Machinery, Testing

column2: Hi  We are hiring Packaging Engineer for US based big MNC Packaging Engineer Salary : 10 - 25 LPA Experience : 5 - 20 Years Location : Remote or Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Pune, Mumbai, Delhi/NCR, Ahmedabad Job Type : Full Time Design and Development:  Create functional and cost-effective packaging solutions using various materials (glass, plastic, metal, etc.) considering factors like product protection, sustainability, and branding. Testing and Analysis:  Conduct rigorous testing to assess the packaging's performance under different conditions (vibration, temperature, pressure) to simulate real-world shipping and storage. Standards and Regulations:  Ensure packaging adheres to industry regulations, safety standards, and environmental considerations. Cost Optimization:  Balance the need for durable, protective packaging with minimizing material usage and overall production costs. Collaboration:  Work effectively with cross-functional teams (marketing, manufacturing, logistics) to ensure the packaging aligns with product requirements, branding strategies, and production efficiency. Supplier Management:  Research, source, and qualify packaging material suppliers, negotiating contracts and ensuring quality control. Staying Ahead of the Curve:  Keep up-to-date on packaging trends, new materials, and sustainable practices to implement innovative solutions.

column2: Job Purpose : As our detail-oriented and driven Operations Manager you will play a key role in delivering exceptional customer experiences for customised projects. You'll be the maestro behind the scenes, ensuring everything runs smoothly from customer enquiry to fulfilment. Key Responsibilities:  Your key responsibility is to turn an enquiry into an order and fulfil it to customer satisfaction in time, quality and specifications. Here's what you'll be doing: Customer Service:  You'll be the first point of contact for customer email or webform inquiries, managing their questions and requests with a smile. Quote Management:  Turning enquiries into accurate and competitive quotes is your forte. Order Management:  Once an order is placed, you'll take the lead, managing the entire order processing flow. Technical Acumen:  For custom projects, you'll collaborate with the team to create clear technical drawings, ensuring everything is built to perfection. Quality Control:  Maintaining high-quality standards is crucial, and you'll ensure all custom projects meet our strict QC guidelines. Payments:  Managing payments, tracking orders, and keeping a watchful eye on inventory levels are all part of your financial expertise. Inventory Management:  You'll oversee our Williams Shop inventory, making sure deliveries can get to the Australian warehouse 3 months before products run out of stock. Order Fulfilment:  Orders from the Williams Shop? You'll ensure they're picked, packed, and shipped from the factory directly to happy customers. Essential Skills: Customer Focus:  You're passionate about exceeding customer expectations. You have excellent communication skills and thrive in a service-oriented environment. Organizational Powerhouse:  You're a master of organization and efficiency. Juggling multiple tasks and keeping projects on track is your superpower. Estimating Ace:  You have a keen eye for detail and can create accurate and competitive estimates for customer projects. Technical Savvy:  Understanding of technical drawings and the ability to collaborate effectively with the engineering team is a must. proficiency in SolidWorks or equivalent CAD software for product design Quality Champion:  You have a high standard for quality and ensure all custom projects meet strict QC guidelines. Financial Acumen:  Strong organizational and financial skills are essential to manage payments, track orders, and oversee inventory. Team Player:  You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working with a team to achieve common goals. Preferred candidate profile Diploma Engineering graduate minimum in Mechanical engineering Proven experience 4+ years in ecommerce or customised architectural projects. Bonus Skills: 3D CAD experience Woocommerce order management experience Compliance management of architectural hardware. e.g. experience in? AUNZS standard or Building codes This role offers a dynamic opportunity to be a leader and play a critical role in delivering exceptional custom projects. If you have the skills and passion to make it happen, we want to hear from you! Why Choose Williams Architectural? Innovative Excellence:  Be part of a team that pioneers innovative hardware solutions, setting industry standards worldwide. Global Role:  Gain exposure to the international market, contributing to our success and growth on a global scale. Career Advancement:  Take your career to new heights with clear paths for growth and opportunities for leadership development. Learning and Development Culture:  Experience a supportive work environment that values teamwork, respect, and a huge focus on growth Competitive Benefits:  Receive competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, ensuring your financial security and peace of mind. International Travel:  Exceptional performance in this role may lead to the chance to travel to our headquarters in Australia and other countries as you help it expand Overall, at Williams Architectural, you'll find a fulfilling and rewarding career where you can make a meaningful contribution while growing both personally and professionally. Salary:  5 - 7 lakhs per year (all-inclusive) Bonus:  Up to 20% extra based on your performance. Perks: Paid time off for holidays, vacations & sick leave (4 weeks) Travel compensation for work-related trips Work Schedule:  We operate on a rotating schedule: One week: Monday - Friday Next week: Monday - Saturday Imagine crafting hardware that elevates spaces. Join a legacy, build a future. Ready to turn the ordinary into extraordinary? Join us!

column2: Role & responsibilities  :    Designing and Developing Mechanical Systems : Mechanical engineers often design and develop mechanical systems, products, or components. This could involve creating detailed CAD models, performing engineering calculations, and selecting appropriate materials and manufacturing processes. Analyzing and Testing Prototypes : Mechanical engineers may be responsible for analyzing and testing prototypes to ensure they meet design specifications and performance requirements. This could involve conducting simulations, laboratory testing, or field testing. Improving Existing Systems : Mechanical engineers often work on improving existing mechanical systems or processes to enhance efficiency, reliability, or performance. This could involve troubleshooting issues, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing design changes or upgrades. Project Management : Mechanical engineers may be involved in project management, including planning, scheduling, and coordinating engineering projects. This could involve working with cross-functional teams, managing budgets and resources, and ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget. Collaborating with Cross-Functional Teams : Mechanical engineers often collaborate with other engineering disciplines, such as electrical engineers, civil engineers, and software engineers, as well as with professionals from other departments, such as manufacturing, quality assurance, and procurement. Compliance with Regulations and Standards : Mechanical engineers are often responsible for ensuring that their designs and products comply with relevant regulations, codes, and standards. This could involve staying up-to-date with industry regulations, performing risk assessments, and conducting compliance testing. Documentation and Reporting : Mechanical engineers are typically responsible for creating and maintaining documentation related to their projects, including design documentation, technical specifications, test reports, and project reports. Continuous Learning and Professional Development : Mechanical engineers are expected to stay current with advancements in their field, including new technologies, tools, and techniques. This may involve attending training sessions, workshops, or conferences, as well as pursuing further education or professional certifications. Preferred candidate profile  :      Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineer   Perks and benefits  : Health Insurance:   We provide comprehensive health insurance coverage, including medical, dental, and vision plans, to ensure the well-being of employees and their families. Competitive Salary:   Offer a salary package that is competitive within the industry and reflects the candidate's skills, experience, and qualifications. Paid Time Off:   Provide generous vacation, sick leave, and holiday pay to allow employees to rest, recharge, and spend time with their loved ones.

Capable of working across a broad spectrum of technical areas including noise control, emissions control, fluid/thermal processes, pressure vessels and   pumps. Capable of taking a holistic approach to the HRSG design in order to optimize the overall equipment selection. Responsible for selection of the optimum equipment by working with other HRSG   engineering team including Performance Engineers, Piping Engineers, I&C Engineers, and Structural Engineers. Responsible for evaluating, analyzing and explaining Auxiliary Equipment while working with Proposal Engineers, Service Engineers, Sourcing, Vendors, Customers, and Project Management. Responsible for technical evaluation of third-party equipment suppliers. Responsible for analysis and rectification of incorrectly performing equipment during and after installation. Capable of working with domestic and international customers and vendors. Responsible for the implementation of code requirements including hazardous area classification, and noise. Be responsible for feedback and improvements to the methods and equipment used. Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements. Participate actively in various activities to secure competitiveness of HRSG product Preferred candidate profile:   Must have  ??Role requires 3 - 5 years of experience in the Engineering/Technology & Process Engineering.  Familiarity and experience with Combined Cycle Power Plants, HRSG, Boiler experience is preferred. Entry level candidate in the Engineering/Technology & Process Engineering can apply whereas candidate can demonstrate strong capabilities on defined domain and skills.

column2: Dear Candidate We are hiring JINDAL GROUP OF INDUSTRIES  are currently seeking an experienced MEP Engineer (Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing) as a Deputy General Manager for our Groups upcoming projects in Balaghat, Madhya Pradesh. Job description Project Management: Lead and manage MEP projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines and budget constraints. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including architects, contractors, and other engineering disciplines. Design Oversight: Provide technical expertise and oversight during the design phase of MEP systems in coordination with the directors. Review and approve design documents, drawings, and specifications. Coordination and Integration: Coordinate MEP systems with architectural and structural elements to ensure seamless integration. Budget and Cost Control: Monitor project budgets and costs related to MEP systems Team Leadership: Supervise and mentor a team of Engineers. Coordination with the vendors, civil team for execution of project setup. Skills Required: Should have expertise in setting up of New Green Field Projects. B.tech/B.E. in Mechanical Minimum 10 years of Experience required   Interested candidates can share their CVs on hr@jindaltapes.com or can call on 9289369953
column11: Project Execution, Green Field Projects, MEP, Project Engineering, Industrial Projects, Cost Control, Plant Engineering, Industrial Construction

column2: Role & responsibilities     Develop piping design deliverables, including piping plans, isometric drawings, material take-offs, and pipe support details, in accordance with project specifications, codes, and standards. Perform site visits and inspections to monitor piping installation activities, identify potential issues or conflicts, and provide technical support and guidance to construction teams as needed. Lead the piping engineering team in the layout, and specification of piping systems for oil and gas refinery construction projects, including process piping, utility piping, and fire protection systems. Preferred candidate profile    Full time bachelors degree in respective discipline. Minimum 15 years of overall experience with minimum 3 years of experience of working as Lead Engineer/Area Manager/Superintendent in Oil & Gas Sector and Chemicals. Must have completed one project working as Lead Engineer for EPCM/PMC Consultant
column11: Piping Engineering, EPC, Refinery, Epcm, PMC, Project Management Consultancy, Construction Engineering

column2: Role & responsibilities      1)   Daily and weekly planning of engineering activities. 2) Preparation and   getting approval of product technical data sheets. 3) Ability to understand   engineering drawings and prepare shop drawings for approval by consultant. 4)   Attending meeting with client/consultant/PMC for drawings/data sheet   approvals. 6) Coordinating with operations team for site execution related   issues. 7) Regular visits to site to understand design related issues and to   provide solutions. 8) Value engineering / optimisation of designs. 9)   Preparation of variaiton order statements. 10) Project closeout requirements   like submission of as-built drawings, preparation and submission of O&M   manuals etc. 11) Preparation of detailed Bill of materials based on approved   drawings.     Preferred candidate profile        1)   Experience in MEP field / fire systems in a contracting company. 2) Knowledge in design of fire protection systems as per Indian and   international codes and standards. Knowledge in design of low voltage systems like fire alarm, PA, CCTV etc. will   be an added advantage. 3) Hands on experience in preparing Autocad 2D drawings. 4) Exposure in interacting with consultants, clients & PMC's. 6) Exposure in dealing with vendors and OEM's. 7) Good written and oral communication skills     Perks and benefits
column11: AutoCAD 3D, AutoCAD 2D, AutoCAD Mechanical

column2: * Reviews the electrical drawings / DIS / equip list prior to execution (immediately after loading to factory) so that any rework arising out of errors can be eliminated.     * Studies order-wise actual requirements against loaded drawings to capture errors in design, configuration, wiring, equipment selection, qty, and all relevant aspects.     * Provides relevant structured inputs to vendors, OM and engineering team about errors and their probable solutions (if possible).     * Conducts monthly review / feedback meeting with engineering team so as to spread the knowledge and awareness.     * Maintains proper records / data of the communications / errors / modifications for ease of analysis.     * Issues the requirements for change request management in the projects and provides if necessary inputs.     * Checks the possibilities for technical realization regarding the requirements.     * Drafts the technical realization of the requirements within the technical discipline.     * Acts as a specialized know-how owner for a technical discipline.     * Also responsible for commercial quantification aspect of wiring, wiring consumables and all related items in electrical wirings.     * Supports testing team by providing advance inputs for planning their activities.
column11: Rework, Electrical engineering, Transmission, Siemens, Infrastructure, Management, Electricals, Testing

column2: ?                   Conduct HSE Design activities adhering to the standards specified in the contract scope and complete the design activities within the allotted budget and schedule.                     Provide HSE inputs to the engineering design so that the plant design meets the project HSE requirements.                     Participating in cross-functional and inter-office meetings to provide HSE Design inputs to Engineering Design activities.                     Support the Construction and commissioning field queries.                     Work with Department Head to develop appropriate work procedures and in-house calculations for efficient design activities.                     Develop, promote, and implement design improvements.                     Ensure the project design activities are completed within the allotted manhours and schedule.                     Monitor the manhours consumed.                     Take the role of Lead Engineer for Proposals or Projects, if nominated.                     If working as Lead Engineer on a project then prepare HSEIA Plan and Fortnight Reports to indicate Schedule progress, Quantity, Manhour, Manpower forecasts, Key issues and keep a tight control on the over-runs.                      Visit the design centers to expedite the HSE Design activities or resolve HSE Design issues.                      Maintain a cordial relationship with other discipline Engineers in various work centers to implement HSE Design requirement in the project.                      Fully aware of the Contract scope requirements and standards applicable to the project                      Organize and participate in the HAZID, ENVID, HAZOP, SIL, PHSER review meetings.                      Conduct HAZID, ENVID, Audits and specialist studies if required.                     Carryout the design calculations and get them reviewed from Technical Authorities.                     Own the assigned project documents till the completion of the project.                     Coordinate with other discipline and work center Engineers and ensure that the HSE requirements and Vendor information are implemented in the project design.                     Manage a team of Engineers and Designers.                     Prepare /review safety studies. Prepare /review firewater demand and hydraulic calculations.                     Prepare and review Firewater system PFD, P&ID and datasheets.                     Prepare /review loss prevention layouts and calculations.                     Prepare /review firefighting and safety equipment specifications.                     Prepare /review Inquiry Requisitions, Technical Bid Evaluations and Purchase Requisitions.                     Support the procurement team in finalizing the HSE studies and equipment finalization.                     Liaise with Vendors for on-time delivery and correctness of the vendor documents.                     Provide input and liaise with third party Consultants for study reports. column2: Job Description for HVAC Service Engineer/HVAC Technician Roles and Responsibilities: An HVAC service engineer finds faults, carries out repairs and maintenance, and services and tests HVAC units and systems. There may also be some installation work involved. Work can be undertaken on a wide range of commercial, industrial sites such as offices, hotels, food and drink venues, leisure centres and schools. HVAC work is challenging, both in terms of the technical knowledge needed for the job and the difficulty of diagnosing and repairing HVAC equipment.  The role requires experience and knowledge of testing, repairing and operating HVAC systems, as well as the ability to learn about new ones. Problem-solving is a big part of the job, they often meet clients and other contractors face-to-face so a personable approach, as well as need good communication skills so they can explain what repairs need to be made and why. An HVAC service engineer works both alone and as part of a team, so also needs to be able to interact well with colleagues. They need to be confident working unsupervised on their own initiative or as part of a team. HVAC Technicians also need a variety of highly technical skills. Detailed reports to be prepared for the work done. Training for the same will be given. Skills: ??Understanding the HVAC System and the Components.  ??Capable of using tools. ??Communication. ??Good customer service skills. ??Logical thinking skills. ??Ability to use your initiative. Qualification:  ??Diploma ??Mechanical/Electrical ??ITI ??Mechanical/Electrical

Uses every means (visual aids, working models, etc.) to make presentations exciting and interesting     Identifies the key issues and communicates them concisely and simply     Uses language appropriate to the audience e.g., does not use technical or professional jargon when communicating with people from different disciplines or professions     Adapts communication to other cultural styles     Asks questions to ensure others have understood what they need to do     Explains complex concepts in simple terms     Persuades through debate and logical argument in a non- adversarial way     When appropriate, tells people honestly and positively things they don t want to know         Teamwork and Leadership         Working in a group in a complementary fashion, which when effective, produces a holistic solution; liaising and cooperating with others; and being aware of own and others strengths and weaknesses.     Treats everyone with respect, irrespective of their level, background, gender, or discipline or profession     Gives clear direction on what needs to be achieved, by whom, by when     Ensures that all team members, including support staff, are involved in setting the team s objectives     Understands what the team needs or wants to know, and keeps them informed accordingly     Delegates to maximise development opportunities     Sets an example to colleagues     Monitors performance of others and helps when necessary     Keeps close to what is going on - doesn t leave junior people without support or guidance     Is accessible and approachable to people asking for help and information     Supports and trains junior staff, shares experience     Allows people to do things their way without interfering; intervenes only when necessary to prevent problems     Initiates morale-boosting activities     Encourages and praises, says thank you           Our Values         Accountability: Everyone is accountable.     Integrity: We are straight-talking, respectful, and fair.     Simplicity: Both in our approach and solutions.     Supportive: We are approachable, inclusive, and we recognise success.     Quality: We strive to get it right first time, every time.             Our Strategic Themes         Client first     One Global Team     Employer of Choice     Growth     Innovation

column2: As member of TK-NCA Erection & Commissioning Hub, the Site Mechanical Supervisor, following would be your roles and responsibilities:        You will be in charge to oversee and lead the installation of          In the Office or WFH: : Review site project work package: SoW, Site Instructions, Installation manuals, Risks Analysis & Safety plans ensuring all works are in line with the company standards and Client specification.          Study project documentation, prepare detail report about changes made on site and cooperate to the engineering offices.          Define, in conjunction with Project Manager and Commissioning Manager the Erection strategy and the associated schedule ensuring they adhere to contractual requirements          At Site : Support Clients with identification of delivered material/equipment and advise the correct handling for schedule optimization. Report any shortage or deviation on the packing list.          Inspect and evaluate status of civil works prior to commence TK-NCA plants erection.          Oversee the mechanical engineering aspects of the installed equipment & Instruments, ensuring compliance with design specifications, industry regulations, and safety standards.          Proactively identify potential issues in the mechanical system installation or equipment/Instruments, and promptly report them to the appropriate stakeholders.          Work closely with the project team to develop effective solutions and ensure timely resolution of problems.          Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements, safety protocols, and company policies pertaining to mechanical installations and construction.          Prepare regular progress & technical reports, maintain accurate documentation, and update relevant records related to Installation activities.          Implement and enforce strict quality control measures to maintain the highest standards of workmanship in all mechanical activities on the site.          Ensure safety throughout all plant erection phase (open the work permit, if applicable, and promote risk assessment within NCA team);          Be the focal point and representative of NCA on site towards client , during Mechanical Erection phase of the plant till MC (Mechanical Completion)          Lead and direct all Erection activities in scope coordinating NCA team members (Civil, Mechanical, E&I) and Vendors, to achieve the plant Mechanical Completion          Responsible to ensure proper documentation and reporting of related activities (Progress reports, Punch List, Materials Certificates, etc.);          Be involved and participate in client, vendor, and/or subcontractor meetings to resolve issues;          Previous experience in closely related position from 10 years        Rights/Authorities        Instruct the NCA / Subcontractor s team members;          Take decision on daily basis to guarantee a smooth erection process;          In coordination with the Project Management, negotiate and agree with the client on any change related to Installation topics;          Mobilize, demobilizes and replace the NCA Installation team members according to site and progress requirements;          Resolve technical issues or disputes, if in the interest of overall project management or the decision violates contractual, safety or quality requirements.              Your profile            The ideal candidate must satisfy the following requirements :          Strong mechanical background, Basic education qualification is : Completed university studies as a associate degree/graduate engineer or comparable degree (preferably Mechanical Engineer)      Previous experience in closely related position from 10 years minimum of specific experience as Supervisor in Construction, Oil & Gas or Chemical industry, Power Plants (Experience in Electrolysis will be a plus);      Previous experience managing work crews and teams with a blend of different cultures and nationalities is considered as a plus      Demonstrated ability to interface with the client to understand requirements and providing technical insight and advice on a wide range of project areas (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical & Instrumentation).      Fluent in English both verbal and written (German, Italian or/and other European languages are a plus);      Availability to travel on prolonged stay at site in India & abroad (focus Middle-East, US and Europe);      High attention to HSE topics and procedures;      Capability to manage stressful situations;      Practical approach with troubleshooting and problem solving;      Knowledge of the IT tools: MS Office, Design softwares (i.e. AutoCAD, Navisworks, etc.), MS Project.                          Your benefits          Electrolysis Green Hydrogen & Chlor Alkali Technology Provider for a livable planet.    Working on Global clients.    You will be part of new establishment for upcoming generation.    Company believes in Innovation and Employee Empowerment.    Excellent work culture

column2: The Commissioning Engineer provides highly technical support to an international client base       The Commissioning Engineer primarily executes customer requests for installation, commissioning, repair and troubleshooting of rotating equipment               Summary                  Responsible for commissioning (and site repair) electrical and mechanical systems and components.              Read and interpret drawings such as mechanical assemblies, control/power panels, schematics, and piping & instrumentation diagrams.              Excellent technical knowledge and possess good manual dexterity.              Ability to read instructions in manuals, drawings, schematics, etc., and precisely follow them.              Be able to troubleshoot basic to medium complexity issues related to built systems' electrical and mechanical functionality.                  Essential Functions/Responsibilities                  Reasonable actions may be made to perform essential functions for Nikkiso Products.              Test transmitters, switches, valves, etc., on arrival and final assembly installation.              Perform and document functional tests of mechanical and electrical equipment after final assembly.              Program and troubleshoot control equipment such as temperature controllers, VFDs, burner management systems, etc.              Read assembly drawings, wiring schematics, and piping & instrumentation diagrams to confirm equipment functionality after it is built.              Travel to sites to help install, commission, or troubleshoot equipment.              Follow the direction of the other senior technicians.              Verify that the specifications of the equipment built are correct.              Troubleshoot malfunctions as needed.              Ensure the working environment is clean and safe.              Report and/or make recommendations to engineering for possible improvements on products.              Work with the shop and sometimes assist with components' assembly or wiring as needed.              Works with customers to determine work scope, provide quotations, necessary parts and tool lists and other logistic considerations necessary to prepare for field service personnels work.              Generates long-term corrections to CARs.              Provides technical support to various internal teams.              Maintains an at-home office for activities in between service calls, if not posted at NCI              Performs pre-commissioning and commissioning activities.              Performs highly skilled repair and troubleshooting activities.              Provides on-site training to customers to improve the customers ability to effectively operate, troubleshoot, and maintain equipment.              Completes a Field Service report after providing site services.                  Knowledge and Critical Skills/Expertise                  Above average technical communication skills.              Experience reading and interpreting electrical, mechanical and process prints and related technical documentation.              Experience in mechanical and hydraulic calculations and data reductions              Ability to discuss, diagnose and repair products.              Ability to manage a global maintenance program.              Ability to work at customer sites with little direct supervision.              Ability to work safely and effectively within OSHA, and job local laws.              Ability to utilize common PC and Microsoft Office applications.                  Work Environmental and Physical Demands                  To perform the duties of this job, the employee may be required to stand, walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop or kneel, talk and hear, and use fingers and hands to feel objects, tools or controls.              Overtime may be necessary as the work load's dictates. This may include weekdays, weekends, nights and/or holidays, travel required up to 80%.              Job will generally be performed in an office/shop environment and generally requires travel to a clients office, production facility or industrial/construction job site. Conditions will vary at each location, but the conditions listed above will generally apply.              Ability to lift up to 60 lbs.              A valid drivers license is required, and candidates may be required to show a clean driving abstract for travel between the NCI facility locations and client offices as required.              A valid passport, or the ability to obtain a valid passport, is required.              A willingness to work overtime, outside of regular business hours and regular working days, to meet customer needs.              Ability to perform effectively in high stress situations.              Candidates cannot have issues with heights or confined spaces.

Responsibilities        Works mainly without supervision; refers upwards as necessary     Monitors budgets and controlling expenditure to meet financial targets for own areas     Promotes innovation     Sets and meets agreed deadlines     Allocates tasks and coordinates activities     Represents the group / office / discipline / profession internally and externally     Authors official documents e.g., letters and reports for internal or external use     Ensures working as per Black & White s Quality Management System     Undertakes design checks, code compliance, driving the projects and owning them     May, in addition, be responsible for one or more of the following:      Manages projects, work area, or technical skill set     Predicts and plans future resources which may include setting up new projects and project plans     Designs or delivers events, activities, processes, and/or projects which have a major impact on the management of the business     Oversees performance and development of others, providing guidance, training, and motivational and directional feedback               Qualifications        A Bachelor s degree in Mechanical Building Services Engineering from an appropriate education institute, or equivalent qualification or sufficient experience     Experience in data centre design is critical for this role         Developing skills, knowledge, and experience       Taking the initiative in developing self and career; continuously assessing own abilities and aspirations, and evaluates them against suitable development and career opportunities within Black & White; fostering the long-term learning and development of others, and has a focus on the development intent and effect rather than on the formal role of training; striving to advance technical skills which differentiate Black & White from competitors; and demonstrating skill and technical competence in the discipline.       Commits to own and others continuing professional development     Actively develops the knowledge, experience, and skills of others, including those in other groups or offices e.g., acts as a mentor or coach, delivers training events, etc.     Being sought out by others within and outside Black & White for their professional and technical expertise     Supports the technical committee and drives or leads on technical initiatives     Brings wide and varied experience to their professional or technical area e.g., experience in working in different locations     Promotes quality of delivery; strives to get it right first time, every time         Planning and Organising       Identifying objectives clearly, planning actions, allocating tasks, and monitoring progress; coordinating with and informing others as necessary; having the ability to juggle different conflicting demands and priorities; and ensuring delivery is planned to include sufficient time for QA or QC.       Adopts simplicity in approach to problems and solutions     Liaises with other teams, the customer, and other external partners to organise everyone s time efficiently     Makes significant changes in own area to meet strategic needs     Is realistic about own and others capabilities     Ensures people have the investment/resources/training they need to carry out their jobs and projects     Switches quickly between different levels of thinking to be able to stand back and see the big picture     Runs meetings efficiently, issues agendas in good time, ensures subjects are covered and actions taken         Thinking and Decision Making       Analytical, creative, and conceptual thinking; the ability to evaluate options, consider the consequences and implications, reach conclusions, and make recommendations and decisions.       Deals with complex escalated problems within own area     Creates new or better operational processes     Makes time to review projects to identify and learn from successes and problems     Thinks beyond the immediate task in hand and considers the impact of decisions further down the line     Challenges existing working practices and suggests improvements     Identifies patterns and trends and recommends action     Provides in-depth analysis of problems and proposes solutions     Brings others in to contribute to solutions     Fosters the development of new ideas in others         Commercial Awareness and Acumen       Understanding the importance of financial success and the willingness or ability to act in the interest of achieving it; negotiating the best terms for Black & White; managing legal and contractual aspects; and desiring to work efficiently, as time is money.       Ensures Black & White competes effectively through a thorough understanding of external market conditions (fees, scope of service, conditions)     Includes contingency allowances in negotiated fees/costs/budgets     Benchmarks fees or costs against market rates     Works to minimise costs and risks, and maximise income     Demonstrates good commercial judgement, evaluating risks and making recommendations to reject commercially unattractive opportunities     Negotiates most favourable contractual and financial terms and conditions with customers or suppliers     Considers alternative fee structures, minimizes or caps the liability of Black & White in any agreement     Knows what the One Global Team approach can offer and promotes this to the customers     Understands Black & White s financial bidding processes and complies with them     Delegates work to achieve best value     Tenaciously chases cash for own projects         Building Customer/Client Relationships       The desire to delight customers (may be other individuals or offices within Black & White) by concentrating on discovering, understanding, and satisfying needs; networking, bringing people, opportunities, and activities together; and arranging win/win solutions.       Acts with integrity, is straight-talking, respectful, and fair     Liaises with customers, keeps them informed, seeks feedback, listens to complaints and praise, manages expectations, and responds appropriately     Keeps in touch with customers between projects     Tailors service offered to customers needs (real and perceived)     Is firm with customers when appropriate without causing unnecessary confrontation     Identifies influencers and decision makers     Thinks of how a person can be of value to other people they know     Invests own time in fostering relationships with external business associates     Proactively looks for potential issues and activities in terms of public relations         Communication       Receiving, interpreting, and imparting information and ideas, both written and spoken, to a wide range of people, influencing others.       Uses every means (visual aids, working models, etc.) to make presentations exciting and interesting     Identifies the key issues and communicates them concisely and simply     Uses language appropriate to the audience e.g., does not use technical or professional jargon when communicating with people from different disciplines or professions     Adapts communication to other cultural styles     Asks questions to ensure others have understood what they need to do     Explains complex concepts in simple terms     Persuades through debate and logical argument in a non- adversarial way     When appropriate, tells people honestly and positively things they don t want to know     Communicates appropriately sensitive and confidential matters between staff     Mediates disagreements between parties and negotiates work that compromises the benefit of all         Teamwork and Leadership       Working in a group in a complementary fashion, which when effective, produces a holistic solution; liaising and cooperating with others; and being aware of own and others strengths and weaknesses. column2: Mechanical site engineers, also known as field engineers, are responsible for making sure all machinery on a given project is constructed and installed correctly. Usually, these projects are commercial construction projects and involve HVAC systems. Mechanical site engineers can also find employment in the medical and manufacturing industries, as both of these industries require a lot of machinery. Mechanical site engineers spend a majority of their shift on the site of their current project. They are the engineers responsible for bringing the plans outlined in blueprints to life. This role is a full-time position that usually includes weekends off.       Mechanical site engineers delegate tasks to laborers, plumbers, masons, and lower-level engineering technicians. Since some projects are completed outdoors, mechanical site engineers have to prepare for the elements.     Mechanical Site Engineer Duties and Responsibilities     A mechanical site engineers duties and responsibilities vary slightly depending on the industry. We analyzed mechanical site engineer job descriptions to come up with the following list of core duties and responsibilities:         Analyze and Interpret Project Blueprints         Mechanical site engineers dont have to create blueprints often, but they do have to interpret blueprints created by CAD software on a daily basis. They can conceptualize which tasks need to be done in which order to make the blueprint a reality.         Facilitate Construction and Installation of Machine Components         While they don t do much of the actual building themselves, mechanical site engineers are heavily involved in the construction and installation of machine components. This can mean creating machinery from scratch or installing a component as part of a repair.         Test Machine Components for Functionality         Depending on one s industry, there are specific tests for each kind of machinery. It is the responsibility of the mechanical site engineer to run these tests before signing off on completion. If something doesn t perform as expected, he or she is responsible for diagnosing and fixing the problem.         Delegate Tasks to Various Project Employees         Mechanical site engineers are part project manager; they delegate tasks to laborers and technicians, providing guidance as these workers complete their tasks.         Ensure Project is Completed on Time and Budget         Project stakeholders hate when a project costs more time or money than was originally estimated. It is up to the mechanical site engineer to make sure all the mechanical aspects of the project are completed as efficiently as possible.
column11: HVAC, Construction, Mechanical, CAD, Conceptualization, Budgeting, Machinery, Testing
