column2: Job Title:  Senior HVAC Draftsman Department:  Mechanical Engineering Job Location:  Hyderabad, India Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior HVAC Draftsman to join our Mechanical Engineering team in Hyderabad, India. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 10 years of comprehensive experience in the preparation of HVAC shop drawings. As a Senior HVAC Draftsman, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy, quality, and efficiency of our HVAC systems by creating detailed and precise shop drawings. Key Responsibilities: Shop Drawing Preparation: Generate detailed HVAC shop drawings in accordance with project specifications, engineering drawings, and industry standards. Collaborate closely with the engineering team to understand project requirements and incorporate design changes into the drawings. Technical Proficiency: Demonstrate expertise in HVAC systems, ductwork, piping, and equipment layouts. Utilize AutoCAD or other relevant software to produce accurate and detailed drawings. Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough reviews of shop drawings to ensure compliance with project specifications and applicable codes. Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify errors, ensuring accuracy in all deliverables. Communication and Coordination: Effectively communicate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to address design concerns and modifications. Collaborate with the project team to resolve conflicts and discrepancies in the drawings. Documentation: Maintain organized and up-to-date documentation related to shop drawings, revisions, and project communication. Ensure that all drawings are properly archived for future reference and audits. Deadline Adherence: Manage work assignments to meet project deadlines and milestones. Prioritize tasks effectively to ensure timely delivery of accurate shop drawings. Requirements: Minimum of 10 years of experience in HVAC shop drawing preparation. Proficiency in AutoCAD and other relevant drafting software. In-depth knowledge of HVAC systems, ductwork, and piping design. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in drawing creation. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Please note that this position requires working from the office during regular business hours (12 Noon to 9:30 PM, Monday to Friday) and does not support remote work. The job location is Hyderabad, India. If you meet the above criteria and are ready to contribute your expertise to a dynamic engineering team, we invite you to apply for the position of Senior HVAC Draftsman. Role & responsibilities

column2: We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented HVAC Draftsman to join our team.     As an HVAC Draftsman, you will be responsible for creating accurate and comprehensive technical drawings that support the successful implementation of HVAC systems.     Working closely with engineers and project stakeholders, you will play a key role in translating HVAC design concepts into detailed and precise drawings.     Your proficiency in drafting software, knowledge of HVAC systems, and attention to detail will be crucial for the success of our projects.         Qualification   :       Proven experience as a HVAC Draftsman.     Proficiency in AutoCAD and other relevant drafting software.     Strong understanding of HVAC systems, components, and symbols.     Familiarity with HVAC codes and standards related to design and drafting.     Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in drafting technical drawings.     Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.     Knowledge of construction processes and the ability to adapt designs to practical considerations.     Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.     Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on industry trends and advancements     Bachelor s degree in engineering or a related field.     Demonstrated proficiency in using AutoCAD and other relevant drafting tools.     Proven track record of successfully translating HVAC designs into accurate technical drawings.     Experience working on [specific types of HVAC systems or projects, if applicable].     Knowledge of HVAC codes and standards, with a commitment to staying updated on changes.     Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt designs to practical constraints.     Excellent teamwork and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with engineers, architects, and other stakeholders.     A proactive and self-motivated approach to work, with a commitment to meeting project deadlines.

column2: Job Description: We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Draughtsman to join our HVAC Coil Manufacturing Design team at the?INDIA HUB office. The successful candidate will be integral to our design process, responsible for preparing accurate and detailed HVAC equipment coil drawings based on customer specifications or data sheets from coil selection software. This role is crucial for maintaining the precision and efficiency of our manufacturing process, enabling us to continue providing our customers with high-quality, tailor-made coil replacements. Key Responsibilities: Create detailed drawings of HVAC coils using AutoCAD, based on specifications provided by customers or generated from coil selection software, in coordination with the Sales/Application team.? Ensure drawings are accurate, conform to standards, and meet all necessary specifications for manufacturing. After drawing preparation, obtain customer approval before releasing it to production to ensure all requirements are met and the client is satisfied with the design. Work closely with the manufacturing team to translate drawings into practical, manufacturable designs (CAM). Manage multiple drafting projects simultaneously, adjusting priorities as needed to meet tight deadlines. Collaborate with the design team to innovate and improve design processes and outputs. Adapt to on-site challenges and provide creative solutions to unforeseen problems during the design and manufacturing phases. Stay updated with the latest drafting technologies and HVAC industry trends to continually enhance the efficiency and quality of designs. Preferred candidate profile     A minimum of 5 to 6 years of experience in mechanical drafting, including at least 2 to 3 years in an HVAC unit manufacturing environment. Technical qualification in Mechanical Engineering (DME) or equivalent, with formal training in AutoCAD. Proficiency in AutoCAD is mandatory, with a strong ability to produce detailed and precise drawings. Experience with CAM programming and familiarity with additional CAD software is a significant advantage. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet strict deadlines. Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to address challenges that may arise during the design and manufacturing processes. A solid understanding of HVAC systems and components, especially coils, is highly preferred.

Ensure proper placement of HVAC vents, ducts, and diffusers to maintain desired airflow patterns and temperature control.             Technical Expertise :             Develop a deep understanding of cleanroom design principles, HVAC Systems, including airflows, contamination control, spatial arrangement, and equipment integration.         Interpret and implement engineering drawings, equipment datasheets, and process flow diagrams into cleanroom layouts.             Software Proficiency :             Utilize computer-aided design (CAD) software (eg, AutoCAD, Revit) proficiently to create and edit cleanroom layouts.         Stay updated with the latest CAD tools and techniques to enhance design efficiency and accuracy.             Quality and Accuracy :             Ensure precision and attention to detail in all layout designs to accurately represent the intended cleanroom configuration.         Review and validate drawings for completeness, correctness, and adherence to project specifications.             Communication and Collaboration :             Collaborate closely with architects, engineers, project managers, and other stakeholders to integrate design elements seamlessly.         Explain cleanroom layouts and design concepts clearly to non-technical team members and clients.             Documentation and Records :             Maintain organized and up-to-date records of all cleanroom layout designs, revisions, and versions.         Generate accurate bill of materials (BOM) and specifications for equipment placement and installation.             Site Visits :             Conduct periodic site visits to inspect cleanroom construction progress and ensure that the actual implementation aligns with the design intent.         Address any design-related queries or issues during site visits and provide solutions as needed.             Qualifications and Skills :             Diploma or Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Architectural Drafting, or related field         Proficiency in CAD software, such as AutoCAD, Revit, or equivalent.             Strong understanding of cleanroom design principles and standards.         Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.         Attention to detail and ability to work with precision.         Problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.         Prior experience in cleanroom design or related field is a plus.
column11: HVAC, Layout design, Construction, Architecture, AutoCAD, CAD, Ventilation, REVIT, MEP Draughtsman, Mechanical engineering

column2: We are seeking a highly experienced HVAC Design Manager. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 10-15 years of hands-on experience in HVAC system design. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the success of various kinds of HVAC systems across the sectors by leading and executing HVAC design efforts. Role & responsibilities     1.  HVAC System Design:  Lead the design and development of HVAC systems with all designs are compliant with relevant codes, standards, and regulations. 2.  Technical Expertise:  Apply deep knowledge of HVAC engineering principles and practices to provide innovative and efficient HVAC design solutions. 3.  Project Leadership:  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration of HVAC systems. 4.  Feasibility Studies:  Participate in feasibility studies to evaluate HVAC system requirements and provide expert insights to guide project decision-making. 5.  Equipment Selection:  Select appropriate HVAC equipment, components, and materials based on project requirements, performance criteria, and cost-effectiveness. 6.  Simulation and Analysis:  Utilize advanced HVAC simulation tools and software to perform system analysis, energy modeling, and thermal load calculations to optimize HVAC system performance. 7.  Quality Assurance:  Oversee the review and approval of HVAC design deliverables, including drawings, specifications, and calculations, to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements. 8.  Client Interaction:  Act as a technical point of contact for clients, addressing their questions, concerns, and feedback related to HVAC design aspects of power plant projects. 9.  Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and challenges related to HVAC design, develop mitigation strategies, and ensure that all design solutions are aligned with safety and environmental standards. Preferred candidate profile     1. bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or related field. Master's degree is a plus. 2. 10-15 years of progressive experience in HVAC system design 3. Professional Engineer (PE) licensure is preferred. 4. Proficiency in HVAC design software and simulation tools (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit, TRACE 700, etc.). 5. Thorough understanding of relevant codes and standards (ASHRAE, NFPA, etc.). 6. Strong project management skills and experience leading cross-functional teams. 7. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders. 8. Demonstrated track record of successful HVAC system design implementations within power plant projects. 9. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. 10. Commitment to staying updated with industry trends and advancements in HVAC technology. Perks and benefits   More than the Industry Bench Mark

column1: Sr Mechanical Engineer/ Asst Manager - Mechanical
column2: This role is responsible for overseeing the installation, operation, and maintenance of mechanical structures in buildings and infrastructure within the construction process.       ?       About the Role:          Monitor construction work on daily basis to ensure that it is carries out according to approved plans, specifications and method statements.     Conduct regular site inspections to identify any quality or safety issues and take corrective actions whenever necessary     Verify that all materials used on project meet the required standards and are stored and handled correctly     Ensure that workers are following approved method statements and standard operating procedures for construction work.     Document all inspection and tests carried out on the construction site, and maintain accurate records of construction progress, material used and labour hours     Co-operate with project stake holders, including the clients, consultants & sub-contractors, to ensure that all parties are informed of construction progress and any issues that arise.     Monitoring of quality standards as per QAP guidelines     Ensure the material, Equipment & labour availability     Need to handle the quality engineer role and responsibility up to some extent.     Need to guide the working agencies on available work front.     Carry out the inspection and checking for all quality related procedure in the site and ensure activity at site as per approved method of statement including closure of Non-compliance report     Perform all daily inspection and test of the scope and characters necessary to achieve the quality of construction required in the drawing and specifications for all works under the contract performed ON or OFF the site     Co-ordinate with contractor representative and site engineer in charge for inspection and adherence on quality aspects including the closure of Non-compliance report     Co-ordinate with contractor quality engineer for submission of material submittals with quality details.     Responsible for quality and workmanship of every activity, Thorough knowledge of all phases of engineering construction related to structural fabrication / erection, equipment erection / alignment like reactors, glass line reactors, heat exchanger and other process equipment, piping fabrication / erection, measurement verification, pre-commissioning & commissioning activities.     Co-ordinating with Civil department for equipment ready for erection / released for grouting after alignment.     Monitor policies and procedures and report any areas where improvement is required.     Checking of P&ID, Isomatric drawing, MOC of equipment & piping and assembly work with respect to approved GA drawing d and ensuring adequacy of same.     Monitoring on insulation activities, work front release after hydrostatic test of piping / equipment.     Maintain good professional relation with Client and eager to resolve major issues related to Site concerns.         About You:          B.E BE Mechanical with 12 to 15 years of experience particularly in warehouse / industrial projects.     Technical awareness of civil, electro-mechanical, and architectural works     Excellent organizational and motivational skills     Outstanding attention to detail and observation ability     Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities           Why join Cushman & Wakefield           Being part of a growing global company;     Career development and a promote from within culture;     An organisation committed to Diversity and Inclusion

column2: Role & responsibilities     System Design:  MEP engineers work closely with architects and other stakeholders to design mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems that meet the specific needs and requirements of a building. They analyze the buildings layout and purpose to determine the most appropriate system design. Load Calculations:  They perform calculations to determine the heating and cooling loads required for the HVAC systems. This helps in selecting the appropriate equipment and ensuring the building?? energy efficiency. Equipment Selection:  Based on the design and load calculations, MEP engineers select the appropriate mechanical and electrical equipment, such as HVAC units, pumps, generators, electrical panels, lighting fixtures, etc. Code Compliance:  MEP engineers must ensure that all the systems they design and install comply with relevant building codes, safety standards, and regulations. Coordination:  They work closely with architects, structural engineers, and other professionals to ensure that their systems integrate seamlessly with the overall building design and structure. Cost Estimation:  MEP engineers provide cost estimates for the installation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems, helping project managers and clients to budget appropriately. Construction Supervision:  During the construction phase, MEP engineers may be involved in overseeing the installation of systems to ensure that the work is carried out correctly and meets the design specifications. Energy Efficiency and Sustainability:  MEP engineers strive to design systems that are energy-efficient and environmentally friendly, reducing the building?? environmental impact and operational costs. Testing and Commissioning:  Before the building is occupied, MEP engineers conduct testing and commissioning to ensure that all systems function correctly and meet the performance standards Preferred candidate profile   DIPLOMA IN MECHANICAL ENGINEER Perks and benefits   ATTRACTIVE SALARY
column11: Mechanical Engineering, Plumbing Design, AUTOCAD, Mep Design, Phe, HVAC Engineering, Fire Fighting

Prepare design calculations on basis of approval of DBR prepared by Sr. design Engineers / design engineers.  Preparation for Effluent drain layout and calculation.  Preparation for mechanical tender & fire tender document  Prepare Piping support design for steam, Thermic fluid, compressed Air, cooling water, chilled water, raw water, process water soft water, gas line etc.  Prepare & review the pipe rack layout and section\ detail.  Preparation for Underground tank, raw water tank, soft water tank, Air receiver Tank etc.  Design of Rainwater/Stormwater drainage and preparation of layout as per provisions of the NBC. Preparation of tender specification & BOQ for all equipment/systems, tender evaluation, interaction under the guidance of Sr. Engineer/HOD. Prepare design calculations for Roof gutter sizing and downtake pipes.  Seek inputs from stress analysis reports and coordinate with other disciplines for design of pipe racks. column2: Position Summary As a Mechanical Engineer ,  you will join complementary teams of developers to participate in the specification, design, testing, maintenance, and implementation of design changes for analytica l  instruments and allied products. How you will make an impact As part of the R&D team, we collaborate with global multi-functional teams (electrical, mechanical, user experience, manufacturing, quality, sourcing) during all phases of the new product development (NPD) process to design innovative, high quality reliable refrigerated products, that meet customer requirements and time to market commitments within target costs. Develop specifications for system-level, subsystem and component performance based on customer needs and product requirements. Develop the optimal design through Computer Aided Engineering (CAE), Tradeoff Analysis, Technology Assessment, Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) Develop and implement test plans to validate the performance of newly developed products by applying design for reliability tools and performance sensitivity analysis. Work with Regulatory Affairs team members to design products that meet and acquire the required product approvals and certifications such as, FDA, UL, CE, CSA, NSF, and Energy Star Identify and implement design changes that improve user experience, quality, manufacturability, serviceability and sustainability of cold storage products. We integrate innovative new technology and intellectual property into our designs as we develop future exciting products! Good written and verbal communication skill High levels of self-discipline, drive and proven ability to coordinate personnel in the implementation of design changes Good analytical skills, data interpretation and root cause analysis experience Project management experience Good sense of ownership in projects and work assignments with persistence to overcome project obstacles and drive work to completion. column2: At Visteon, the work we do is both relevant and recognized not just by our organization, but by our peers, by industry-leading brands, and by millions of drivers around the world.  Thats YOUR work. And, as a truly global technology leader in the mobility space, focused on building cross-functional AND cross-cultural teams, we connect you with people who help you grow. So here, whatever we do is not a job. It?? a mission.  As a multi-billion-dollar leader of disruptive change in the industry, we are shaping the future, while enabling a cleaner environment. No other industry offers more fast-paced change and opportunity. We are in the midst of a mobility revolution that will completely change the way we interact with our vehicles, reduce the number of car accidents and fatalities, and make the world a cleaner place.  Visteon is at the epicenter of this mobility revolution.  Two major trends in the automotive industry ??the shift to electric vehicles and vehicles with autonomous safety technologies ??have created unique opportunities for Visteon. We are the only automotive provider focused exclusively on cockpit electronics ??the fastest-growing segment in the industry.  And our team is ready for YOU. To show the world what you can do. Detailed description:  CAE Structural Analysis - Principal Engineer Enabling a software-defined, electrified future. Visteon is a technology company that develops and builds innovative digital cockpit and electrification products at the leading-edge of the mobility revolution. Founded in 2000, Visteon brings decades of automotive intelligence combined with Silicon Valley speed to apply global insights that help transform the software-defined vehicle of the future for many of the world?? largest OEMs. The company employs 10,000 employees in 18 countries around the globe. To know more about us click here. Mission of the Role:  Principal Engineer I Mechanical is an individual contributor. Support CAE activities for the Product Development & Sustaining activities with clear understanding of problem-solving techniques. Propose solutions for New CAE methods and improve the existing method / process. Should have the ability to lead, guide and mentor the young engineers in their Capability and competency development. Key Objectives of this Role:  Independently handle the CDC, IVI, Electrification projects assigned to him, support and execute the CAE simulations and provide clear solutions incase of any issues / problems. Project Management & Process Compliance within and out of the team Communication, Co-ordination with relevant stakeholders across all regions Ensure quality of deliverables with 100% First Time Right and On Time Delivery Provide technical & professional guidance and support to peer members. Key Performance Indicators:  Respect Visteon development process with no NC during internal Mechanical audits Achieve Mechanical milestones defined by program team. Key Year One Deliverables:  Take independent responsibility of one forward program meeting delivery schedule without any slippage. Meet the respective guidelines defined in the Visteon development process. Qualification, Experience and Skills:  Master?? / Bachelor?? Degree in Mechanical Engineering 6 to 12 years of relevant experience preferably in regional or global environment. Experience in Automotive CAE simulations handling Structural Analysis like Linear, Nonlinear Static, Modal and Frequency Response Analysis, Fatigue Analysis at full vehicle level or Assembly or Component level. Exposure to CAE and testing domains, preferably in Displays, Infotainment, Cockpit Electronic products, Electrification vehicles products. Proficiency in Altair Hyperworks Simulation Platform, Other CAE structural software Expertise in Thermal Simulations using Flotherm XT is an added advantage. Must be flexible, dependable, and capable of learning new products and technologies. Key Behaviors:  Creativity & Innovation Problem Solving & Decision Making Collaboration & Result Orientation Teamwork & Leadership Visteon values and beliefs Reporting Structure: Reporting to Senior Manager ??Mechanical Engineering (CAE Global Projects) Visteon Culture: If you thrive in a fast-paced, organizational culture that requires agility, adaptability, and a growth mindset from its employees to thrive and stay ahead of the curve Visteon is the place. We value high performance and a drive for results. Innovation, risk-taking, and continuous learning help us keep up with the ever-changing landscape of our industry and be Market leaders. At Visteon you can be more. More Good Reasons to Work for Visteon Focusing on the Future Our company strategy focuses on leading the evolution of automotive digital cockpits and safety solutions. This strategy is driven by constant innovation, and you will support our efforts through your role. We are recognized across the industry for innovation. We have a strong book of business that is expected to drive future growth, along with a customer base that includes almost every automotive manufacturer in the world. Company Culture Working at Visteon is a journey in which our employees can develop their strengths and advance their careers while making a difference globally. Join us and help change the world and how we interact with our vehicles. Visteon is where the best technical talent creates the future. Learn more about our culture here. Competitive Compensation and Benefits Visteon offers competitive salaries and benefits and an environment that encourages employees to achieve their career goals. About Visteon Visteon is a global technology company serving the mobility industry, dedicated to creating a more enjoyable, connected and safe driving experience. The company?? platforms leverage proven, scalable hardware and software solutions that enable the digital, electric, and autonomous evolution of our global automotive customers. Visteon products align with key industry trends and include digital instrument clusters, displays, Android-based infotainment systems, domain controllers, advanced driver assistance systems and battery management systems. The company is headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, and has approximately 10,000 employees at more than 40 facilities in 18 countries. Visteon reported sales of approximately $2.8 billion and booked $5.1 billion of new business in 2021.Learn more at www.visteon.com. Follow Us For more information about our company, technologies and products, follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. You can also follow our careers-focused channels on Twitter and Facebook to keep up with our latest job postings and the great work our employees are doing.

column2: Key Responsibilities : Design Development : Create innovative mechanical designs, considering factors such as functionality, manufacturability, cost, and user experience. This includes components, assemblies, and systems. CAD Modeling : Utilize Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) to develop detailed 3D models and 2D drawings of mechanical designs. Ensure accuracy and adherence to design standards. Simulation and Analysis : Conduct Finite Element Analysis (FEA), Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), and other simulations to assess performance, strength, and durability of designs. Interpret results and iterate designs accordingly. Prototyping and Testing : Coordinate the prototyping and testing of mechanical designs. Analyze test data and feedback to refine designs and address any issues. Collaboration : Work closely with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers, industrial designers, and manufacturing personnel, to ensure seamless integration of mechanical designs into overall product development processes. Documentation : Prepare comprehensive documentation, including design specifications, technical drawings, and test reports. Maintain accurate records of design iterations and revisions. Cost Optimization : Identify opportunities for cost reduction through design improvements, material selection, and manufacturing process optimization, without compromising quality or performance. Regulatory Compliance : Ensure designs comply with relevant industry standards, regulations, and safety requirements. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices. Qualifications : Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Advanced degree (e.g., Master??) preferred. Proven experience in mechanical design, preferably in a similar industry or product domain. Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) and simulation tools (e.g., ANSYS, MATLAB). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex technical requirements and constraints. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and present ideas clearly to stakeholders. Familiarity with manufacturing processes, materials selection, and design for assembly (DFA) principles. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality designs on time and within budget. Additional Skills (Preferred) : Experience with 3D printing, additive manufacturing, or rapid prototyping techniques. Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T) standards. Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools. Understanding of mechatronics and electromechanical systems. Experience with product lifecycle management (PLM) software.

column2: Job Summary: The Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and testing mechanical components and systems for our lighting products. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineering, product design, and manufacturing, to ensure the successful development and production of high-quality lighting solutions. Key Responsibilities: 1. Design and Development: o Develop detailed mechanical designs, including 3D models and 2D drawings, for new lighting products. o Design enclosures, heat sinks, and mounting systems to optimize product performance and aesthetics. o Select appropriate materials and manufacturing processes to meet product specifications and performance criteria. 2. Prototyping and Testing: o Create prototypes using various fabrication methods (e.g., 3D printing, CNC machining). o Conduct mechanical and thermal testing to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. o Analyze test data and make design adjustments as necessary. 3. Project Management: o Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely completion and adherence to budget. o Collaborate with project managers and other stakeholders to define project scope, timelines, and deliverables. 4. Documentation and Compliance: o Prepare detailed engineering documentation, including design specifications, test reports, and assembly instructions. o Ensure products comply with relevant safety and performance standards (e.g., UL, CE, RoHS). 5. Continuous Improvement: o Stay current with advancements in mechanical engineering practices and lighting technology. o Identify opportunities for improving product performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. o Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members. Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Experience: 3+ years of experience in mechanical engineering, preferably in the lighting industry. Technical Skills: o Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD, or similar). o Strong understanding of mechanical design principles and manufacturing processes. o Knowledge of thermal management in lighting systems. o Familiarity with materials science and selection.

column2: Role & responsibilities  :   Take care of agricultural field durability and end-to-end on-field performance testing of the robots. ??Prepare the DVP, report, and execute the test according to the project plan. ??About to learn the other domains of testing software, electronics, etc. to know the cause of failures. ??Collaborate with stakeholders to understand testing parameters, test schedules, strategies, project scope, and deployment plan. ??Responsible for assessing bugs, errors, and failures priority and severity and effectively sharing the same with the various stakeholders. ??Reporting, follow-up, bug/error/failure tracking, and risk and escalation management ??Travel to the various regions where testing is carried out, viz., Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat, and Punjab, for seasonal testing. ??Coordinate all ground-level activities. ??Work closely with the production team to understand why were building a product and the specific requirements. ??Inspect materials and machinery to identify defects and malfunctions. ??Monitor all production stages to ensure safety procedures are followed. ??Intent to create the new test rigs with respect to the projects ??Run quality controls on components and final products. ??Develop test environments and test cases for all mechanical and electrical systems. ??Analyze test results, detect issues, and track root causes. ??Suggest fixes and improvements. ??Document technical issues and solutions. ??ORC management ??Build automated testing systems for regular checks. Preferred candidate profile  :We are looking for a test engineer who will be responsible for carrying out durability and performance testing of our robots on the field in coordination with the various stakeholders. They would need to be proficient in preparing the Design Verification Plan (DVP) with respect to the project timeline and execute the test. The test engineer will report to the Machine Testing Lead.   Perks and benefits  : Performance based incentives and other allowances as applicable.

column2: Reporting to the Principal Engineer - Mechanical, this role will work in collaboration with local and global teams to meet the objectives     The ideal candidate will have experience in designing and managing projects, and must have knowledge to work on Excel, HAP, Pipe Flo, Navis, and BIM 360     Experience in data centre design is also critical for this role                   We have ambitious growth plans, so key priorities will include:         Developing skills, knowledge, and experience in mechanical services and other disciplines     Planning, organising, and coordinating all disciplines     Thinking and decision making with assistance where required     Communication in clear terms, both oral and written     Teamwork and leadership are keys to success at this level     This is a hands-on role, working closely with several global teams alongside local leaders and engineering teams to ensure the required level of resource is in place to deliver the objectives and KPIs of projects.             Responsibilities        Works mainly without supervision; refers upwards as necessary     Promotes innovation     Allocates tasks and coordinates activities     Authors official documents e.g., letters and reports for internal or external use         May, in addition, be responsible for one or more of the following:         Works as per Black & White s Quality Management System     Guides the design engineer, checks the design, ensures code compliance and quality as per Black & White standards           Qualifications        A Bachelors degree in Mechanical Building Services Engineering from an appropriate education institute, or equivalent qualification or sufficient experience     Experience in data centre design is critical for this role         Developing skills, knowledge, and experience           Taking the initiative in developing self and career; continuously assessing own abilities and aspirations, and evaluates them against suitable development and career opportunities within Black & White; fostering the long-term learning and development of others, and has a focus on the development intent and effect rather than on the formal role of training; striving to advance technical skills which differentiate Black & White from competitors; and demonstrating skill and technical competence in the discipline     Seeks opportunities to meet the development needs of self and others     Has achieved a professional qualification, if one exists for the individual s profession in the location, or demonstrates the equivalent level of professional knowledge, experience, and skill     Demonstrates extensive knowledge of specialist area(s)     Keeps up to date professionally or technically, and applies new knowledge and skills     Demonstrates good all-round hands-on design or supervisory experience     Actively ensures people have development plans in place     Encourages and supports the broadening of experience, knowledge, and skills through transfers, secondments, etc.     Provides opportunities for people to enhance their roles and capabilities     Contributes to the development of others by actively sharing expertise e.g., by acting as a mentor     Uses coaching style, questioning to engage individuals and support them to determine their own method and approaches to achieving tasks and goals     Provides technical mentorship     Is skilled in the use of all the software packages necessary to perform the role     Contributes to the discussions of, and development of, solutions to industry issues     Promotes quality of delivery; strives to get it right first time, every time         Planning and Organising         Identifying objectives clearly, planning actions, allocating tasks, and monitoring progress; coordinating with and informing others as necessary; having the ability to juggle different conflicting demands and priorities; and ensuring delivery is planned to include sufficient time for QA or QC.     Adopts simplicity in approach to problems and solutions     Coordinates tasks for others     Sets achievable targets, milestones, and objectives for self and others     Checks progress against budget and deadlines regularly, acts and reports on it     Identifies bottlenecks and organises for additional support to unblock them     Predicts and plans resources and associated costs or fees from a basic understanding of operating costs     Manages time effectively, delegating wherever possible     Has frequent meetings with everyone involved in a project, so all are aware of what is expected of them and the part they play in the project as a whole     Responds to changes in a structured and ordered way     Makes progress on complex issues even when the way ahead is unclear     Adopts a structured approach to recording and storing data     Is able to carry out multiple tasks to use time effectively     Copes with the un-ideal, not always given a clean sheet of paper     Works around what is already in place     Designs and delivers events, activities, processes, or projects which have a major impact on the business     Predicts and plans future resources including setting up new projects and project plans         Thinking and Decision Making         Analytical, creative, and conceptual thinking; the ability to evaluate options, consider the consequences and implications, reach conclusions, and make recommendations and decisions.     Deals forecasts possibilities by interpreting several inputs, balancing, and weighting data to predict and plan likely developments     Builds on previous work to address new situations     Provides innovative solutions to complex problems     Considers a variety of options before making a decision and taking action     Pulls together diverse information into one overall concept     Contributes ideas which improve the outcome     When consensus cannot be achieved, does not allow the matter to drift, but takes a final decision     Considers broader business issues in decision making         Commercial Awareness and Acumen         Understanding the importance of financial success and the willingness or ability to act in the interest of achieving it; negotiating the best terms for Black & White; managing legal and contractual aspects; and desiring to work efficiently, as time is money.     Finds out what is included in the resource allocation and ensures efficient delivery based on this     Monitors and manages resource within the budget     Understands the terms and conditions applicable within the contract and works within these parameters     Actively identifies new business opportunities from existing services delivery, as well as new opportunities     Demonstrates an understanding of the difference between how much something costs in terms of time and/or money, and how much it is worth to the customer     Shows an interest in financial and business results     Avoids loss by carefully handling resource decisions and raising early warnings to project engineers or directors         Building Customer/Client Relationships         The desire to delight customers (may be other individuals or offices within Black & White) by concentrating on discovering, understanding, and satisfying needs; networking, bringing people, opportunities, and activities together; and arranging win/win solutions. column2: As a Mechanical Engineer specializing in robotics, you will play a key role in developing and implementing innovative designs to meet the challenges of our projects.                          We are looking for a talented Mechanical Engineer with a passion for robotics to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1.5 years of experience in mechanical engineering, with a focus on designing and implementing robotic systems.                   Experience: 1.5 - 3 years (Relevant Experience Only)                     Motive               :                 As a Mechanical Engineer specializing in robotics, you will play a key role in developing and implementing innovative designs to meet the challenges of our projects.                     Roles and Responsibilities:                     Design and develop mechanical components and systems for robotic applications.                 Collaborate with electrical engineers and software developers to integrate mechanical systems with control and sensing technologies.                 Utilize CAD software to create detailed designs and specifications for mechanical parts and assemblies.                 Conduct feasibility studies and analysis to evaluate the performance, reliability, and manufacturability of mechanical designs.                 Prototype and test mechanical prototypes to validate design concepts and identify areas for improvement.                 Optimize designs for weight, strength, and functionality while considering factors such as cost and manufacturability.                 Document design specifications, test procedures, and results for reference and future development efforts.                 Stay updated on the latest advancements in robotics technology and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.                     Qualifications               :                   Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Masters degree preferred.                 Minimum of 1.5 years of experience in mechanical engineering, with a focus on robotics or automation.                 Proficiency in CAD software such as SolidWorks, AutoCAD, or Inventor.                 Strong understanding of mechanical design principles, including kinematics, dynamics, and materials science.                 Knowledge of manufacturing processes and techniques for producing mechanical components.                 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.                 Strong communication and teamwork abilities.                         Interview Pre-Requirements:                   Ensure you have the following prerequisites readily available and in optimal working condition prior to commencing your interview:                   A stable and reliable internet connection.                 Writing materials such as a diary and pen for note-taking and problem-solving.                 Functional headphones for clear audio communication.                 Your previous work or portfolio is prepared and accessible.                 Adequate and appropriate lighting in a stationary and comfortable setting.
column11: Automation, Prototype, AutoCAD, CAD, Mechanical, Mechanical design, Continuous improvement, Mechanical engineering, Solid works, Robotics

Experience in the explosive detection/security equipment industry.          Excellent analytical skills          Experience commercializing products. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.          While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit          The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk    Lift and/or move up to 50 pounds          Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception            Tasks            The ME Manager will manage a group whose responsibility is to design and/or specify all the mechanical systems/subsystems for a computed tomography scanner specifically for the explosive detection market using transmission xrays        Designs, scopes, and develops new mechanical engineering initiatives and projects, and manages them through their life cycles          The ME Manager:          Experience with complex electromechanical design and development      Architect and drive the design, development, and testing of mechanical components and systems for multi-energy CT system for security market      Design and develop mechanical components and systems for security CT scanners, including gantry, conveyor, collimators, bearings, sliprings and detector systems      Specifying packaging of purchased subsystems      Experienced with overseeing the prototyping and testing of mechanical components and systems, including coordinating with external suppliers or internal manufacturing teams in a new CT design knowing what is important and what isnt      Managing and mitigating design risks for a security CT scanner      Understand rotating vs stationary architectures      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers, software engineers, and physicists, to ensure seamless integration of mechanical components      Experience in large electromechanical development      Conduct feasibility studies and evaluate design concepts to ensure compliance with performance, safety, and regulatory requirements      Assess design choices technical and commercial viability      Use CAD tools and simulation software to design, analyze, and optimize mechanical design      Especially dynamic large systems simulation (ie not static analysis)      Perform engineering calculations and simulations to verify the structural integrity, design margin, thermal management, airflow and mechanical performance of the security CT design      Deep understanding of mechanical tolerances, safety margins, regulations, air flow, thermodynamics design in an industrial environment      Coordinate with other departments, such as Manufacturing, and Quality Assurance, to ensure timely delivery of mechanical components      Ensure compatibility and maximize commonality with applicable external interface specifications from TSA and third-party BHS integrators      Experienced with CT opportunities for column2: The Commissioning Engineer provides highly technical support to an international client base       The Commissioning Engineer primarily executes customer requests for installation, commissioning, repair and troubleshooting of rotating equipment               Summary                  Responsible for commissioning (and site repair) electrical and mechanical systems and components.              Read and interpret drawings such as mechanical assemblies, control/power panels, schematics, and piping & instrumentation diagrams.              Excellent technical knowledge and possess good manual dexterity.              Ability to read instructions in manuals, drawings, schematics, etc., and precisely follow them.              Be able to troubleshoot basic to medium complexity issues related to built systems' electrical and mechanical functionality.                  Essential Functions/Responsibilities                  Reasonable actions may be made to perform essential functions for Nikkiso Products.              Test transmitters, switches, valves, etc., on arrival and final assembly installation.              Perform and document functional tests of mechanical and electrical equipment after final assembly.              Program and troubleshoot control equipment such as temperature controllers, VFDs, burner management systems, etc.              Read assembly drawings, wiring schematics, and piping & instrumentation diagrams to confirm equipment functionality after it is built.              Travel to sites to help install, commission, or troubleshoot equipment.              Follow the direction of the other senior technicians.              Verify that the specifications of the equipment built are correct.              Troubleshoot malfunctions as needed.              Ensure the working environment is clean and safe.              Report and/or make recommendations to engineering for possible improvements on products.              Work with the shop and sometimes assist with components' assembly or wiring as needed.              Works with customers to determine work scope, provide quotations, necessary parts and tool lists and other logistic considerations necessary to prepare for field service personnels work.              Generates long-term corrections to CARs.              Provides technical support to various internal teams.              Maintains an at-home office for activities in between service calls, if not posted at NCI              Performs pre-commissioning and commissioning activities.              Performs highly skilled repair and troubleshooting activities.              Provides on-site training to customers to improve the customers ability to effectively operate, troubleshoot, and maintain equipment.              Completes a Field Service report after providing site services.                  Knowledge and Critical Skills/Expertise                  Above average technical communication skills.              Experience reading and interpreting electrical, mechanical and process prints and related technical documentation.              Experience in mechanical and hydraulic calculations and data reductions              Ability to discuss, diagnose and repair products.              Ability to manage a global maintenance program.              Ability to work at customer sites with little direct supervision.              Ability to work safely and effectively within OSHA, and job local laws.              Ability to utilize common PC and Microsoft Office applications.                  Work Environmental and Physical Demands                  To perform the duties of this job, the employee may be required to stand, walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop or kneel, talk and hear, and use fingers and hands to feel objects, tools or controls.              Overtime may be necessary as the work load's dictates. This may include weekdays, weekends, nights and/or holidays, travel required up to 80%.              Job will generally be performed in an office/shop environment and generally requires travel to a clients office, production facility or industrial/construction job site. Conditions will vary at each location, but the conditions listed above will generally apply.              Ability to lift up to 60 lbs.              A valid drivers license is required, and candidates may be required to show a clean driving abstract for travel between the NCI facility locations and client offices as required.              A valid passport, or the ability to obtain a valid passport, is required.              A willingness to work overtime, outside of regular business hours and regular working days, to meet customer needs.              Ability to perform effectively in high stress situations.              Candidates cannot have issues with heights or confined spaces.

Acts with integrity, is straight-talking, respectful, and fair     Liaises with customers, keeps them informed, seeks feedback, listens to complaints and praise, manages expectations, and responds appropriately     Keeps in touch with customers between projects     Tailors service offered to customers needs (real and perceived)     Is firm with customers when appropriate without causing unnecessary confrontation     Identifies influencers and decision makers     Thinks of how a person can be of value to other people they know     Invests own time in fostering relationships with external business associates     Proactively looks for potential issues and activities in terms of public relations         Communication       Receiving, interpreting, and imparting information and ideas, both written and spoken, to a wide range of people, influencing others. column2: JOB Description :   Perform VAVE study and identify cost out opportunities which are quality neutral. Perform cost benefit analysis and finalize annualized savings for given project.   Execute cost out opportunity mining exercises within Mechanical domain by spend - pareto analysis, should cost, competitor benchmarking, tear down etc.   Smoothly interfaces to sourcing, operations, quality, service and global R&D team, as well as external suppliers, vendors and customers.   Works as technical expert in mechanical engineering domain, responsible for technical solutions and engineering specifications. Leads standardizations of mechanical design process, optimizes and popularizes design best practice.   Leads project planning/execution in system architecture strategy, engineering proposal as well as mechanical design, development, qualification, validation to ensure system level functionality, performance, safety, and quality in line with the company product     development process   Ensures that assigned projects are delivered on-time, to specification, and at or below target cost by solid engineering plans, including quality, cost, schedule, and risk assessment. Reports on project progress.   Approaches problems in a rational manner and with best in class tools to ensure comprehensive understanding and effective resolution.   Helps team to grow technical depth and knowledge sharing across product lines.   Work with Regulatory Affairs team members to acquire the required product approvals such as, U.L., FDA, C.S.A. and European product certifications. ESSENTIAL SKILLS:   Demonstrated expertise to apply DFx (manufacturability, assembly, serviceability, safety, cost) knowledge to mechanical designs,   expert knowledge in more than two of these specific areas: sheet metal, machining, plastic and die casting. Good understanding of the related   materials, processes and local supplier capability.   Deep knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) and experienced with tolerance analysis.   Hands on in using 3D CAD software tools to perform mechanical design, modeling, and detailing    Demonstrated ability to drive solid engineering solution to   complex problems using best in class tools, with deep understanding of Finite   Element Analysis (FEA), Design of Experiment (DOE) and FMEA.   Knowledge of design with electro-mechanical parts    Strong knowledge of a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system   Must have good communication skills to work globally and across functions

column2: Role & responsibilities     Responsible for reviewing, digesting and technical translation of customer specific requirements from contract documentation Responsible for providing technical assistance, detail equipment selections, specification preparation and delivering engineering deliverables to support a variety of Water Technologies products and systems. The Mechanical Engineer will be significantly involved in the execution phase of the projects as well as providing support during the commissioning stages. The successful candidate will be responsible for design verification and engineering of Process water Treatment projects in accordance with client specifications, National, International and company standards. Responsible for creating Process Calculations and Process Flow Diagrams, defining and producing P&IDs, pump sizing calculations, equipment data sheets and process equipment specifications, selection and detailing of valves, instruments, and equipment schedules, and technical evaluation of supplier proposals and designs. Preparation of mechanical and hydraulic designs; supported by calculations and references. Responsible for supplying necessary inputs to the Design team in preparation of plant layout drawings including civil construction requirement details, pipework system designs, storage and transfer system arrangements, compressed air systems and pneumatic controls system designs. Responsible for reviewing of Process Control Philosophies and Functional Design Specifications to ensure that relevant design and engineering information is coordinated to all disciplines and that process control aspects are included where required, Compilation of specification sheets for the selected equipment. Assist in resolving design issues during manufacture, installation, commissioning and operation of WT products and systems, and liaise with customers with respect to legacy design issues. To comply with, support and develop the Company Quality Assurance System  BS EN:ISO 9001:2008. To work in conjunction with the Application systems engineer and Mechanical design team. To assist the mechanical design team and others in the implementation of company quality Q.A Procedures with regard to Engineering Design Document Control Procedures and assist in the maintenance of the document control system. Maintain an up-to-date awareness and knowledge of various water treatment processes, plant and equipment types and associated suppliers that may be associated or influence the design of EWT products or systems. Knowledge on the Pre-treatment systems, Reverse Osmosis, Electro De-ionization, Polishing & Mixed Beds, Chemical Dosing system, Water treatment process & Distribution systems for Pharma industries, Semi-conductor or electronic industries is desired. Preferred candidate profile   An engineering qualification at Degree level or equivalent, this should be in a mechanical discipline 3 to 8 years experience in Process water treatment like Pre-treatment systems, Reverse Osmosis, Electro De-ionization, Polishing & Mixed Beds, Chemical Dosing system, Water treatment process & Distribution systems for Pharma industries, Semi-conductor or electronic industries is desired. Experience in equipment sizing. Experience with project execution and design check. Experience of pipe & structural steelwork welding methods, codes and techniques. Knowledge and experience with usage of International codes. A good understanding of manufacturing and production methods and processes A good understanding of the cost saving in the projects. International exposure and experience with International clients is desirable.   Skills and competencies Ability to interpret a wide variety of technical instructions which may be presented in diagrammatic form and deal with technically factual information as well as information which is open to interpretation Good problem-solving ability and possess a creative approach for new ideas A good Level of computer literacy Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail Good team-working skills and attitude Good communication, presentation, and reporting skills Be able to work in an organized way with the ability to prioritize and plan effectively

Strong mechanical design fundamentals and understanding of technical concepts in robotics andhardware systems engineering. column1: Shift In Charge (Mechanical) - Lime Calcination Plant
column2: Position Overview:  We are in search of a dynamic individual to assume the role of Lime Calcination Plant Mechanical Shift In Charge. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in overseeing mechanical operations during assigned shifts at our Lime Calcination Plant. This position requires a strong mechanical background, leadership skills, and the ability to ensure the efficient and reliable operation of plant machinery. Responsibilities: Mechanical Operations:  Supervise and coordinate the mechanical activities of the lime calcination plant during assigned shifts. Equipment Management:  Oversee the operation and maintenance of mechanical equipment, including kilns, crushers, conveyors, and other machinery involved in lime production. Troubleshooting:  Lead the troubleshooting efforts to identify and address mechanical issues promptly to minimize downtime. Shift Coordination:  Collaborate with other shift personnel, including operators and maintenance teams, to ensure seamless coordination and handovers between shifts. Preventive Maintenance:  Schedule and oversee preventive maintenance activities for all mechanical equipment to ensure optimal performance. Quality Assurance:  Work closely with the quality control team to ensure that mechanical processes align with quality standards and specifications. Safety Compliance:  Enforce and adhere to safety protocols and procedures to ensure a secure working environment. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of mechanical operations, maintenance activities, and equipment performance. Training and Development:  Provide training opportunities for shift personnel to enhance their mechanical skills and knowledge. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. column2: To perform in detailed commodity categorization by the process of breaking down a commodity into smaller, more specific categories-based characteristics or attributes which help businesses to better understand and manage inventory and make it easier for buyers to find and compare products             Categorization methods expected are.         Product type Price range Brand Material Functionality Usage Location Application                 Identify the OEM or commercial (mechanical) parts from ERP database and understand all the technical as well as quality requirements.     Identify opportunities to identify missing commodity categorization data and to clean-up existing data.     Identify cost saving opportunities through analysis using company provided software (Sievo) data, present to supply chain owner, assist with analysis to support change.     Finding more cost-effective alternatives to current products or services and reducing unnecessary or redundant spending.     By providing detailed, actionable data and insights to the Supply Chain Owners, to make informed decisions and take concrete steps to reduce costs.     Assist Supply chain owners in identifying and negotiating better deals with suppliers.     Overall, helping team to manage and control their spending, such as budgeting, forecasting, and invoice management, preventing overspending and potential budget variances.               Perform FFF (Form-Fit-Function) analysis, also known as side-by-side analysis, to compare and evaluate different products within a specific category     Using this analysis process, identify the strengths and weaknesses of each option and to determine which one offers the best overall value     The process typically involves breaking down the category into several key attributes or features, and then comparing and contrasting each option based on those attributes     This can include factors such as price, quality, performance, features, and customer service             Based on the analysis results, recommend informed decisions about which products or services to purchase to gain best value. Also, identify areas where improvements can be made, or to inform the development of new products or services.     Identify OE / Manufacturer Part Number for highest impact commercial items.     Provide opportunity dashboard of arbitrage opportunities.               Job Skills & Qualification           Bachelors Degree in mechanical engineering.     Min 6-8 years of experience in costing and strategic sourcing.     Sound knowledge in various mechanical OEM components and commercial parts.     Experience in handling ERP system and analytics (preferred Seivo or Power BI).     Good skill in cost analyzing and logistics terms.     Interpretation of drawings/technical specification and understand the product design/quality requirement.     Handle Bill of Materials and Inventory

column2: About Carrier LRR Technologies is currently hiring talented people to work with Carrier Corporation. Carrier Corporation (NYSE: CARR) is a global provider of innovative heating, ventilating, and air conditioning (HVAC), refrigeration, fire, security, and building automation technologies boasting annual sales of over $20 billion, with 58,000 employees spread across 160+ countries. For its R&D center in Hyderabad, Carrier is looking for a talented Sr. Backend Engineer (Dot Net Developer). As were expanding our team located in Hyderabad India, were looking for a talented, highly motivated, and results-driven engineer with expertise in 1D mathematical Thermal modeling. The main responsibility of the ideal candidate will be 1D mathematical model development, software implementation, and testing of standalone models and systems. Roles and Responsibilities   Development of a 1D mathematical model of the different heat exchangers, expense devices, compressors, and other auxiliary components. Testing and documentation of the developed model. Integrate the 1D mathematical model with our propriety software and integrate the model with the system. To solve different Business units queries. EDUCATION / CERTIFICATIONS: Candidates must possess a Master/ Bachler Degree in Mechanical Engineering. A Masters degree in the Thermal domain will be an add-on advantage. Desired Candidate Profile   At least 3 years experience in 1D mathematical modeling in the Thermal domain. Strong knowledge of HVAC/R components, and strong thermal background. Knowledge of programming languages like Fortran, C#, and Modelica. Knowledge of VB6 and Python will add an advantage. Strong technical writing abilities to provide high-quality documentation and standard work. In addition, the ideal candidate should: Be able to work as a part of a multidisciplinary team and in a global environment (our engineers. are located in the US, Italy, France, Germany, China, and India. We collaborate with research institutions worldwide. Observe discipline with the development and adoption of standard development processes. Have a solid track record of working under pressure and focusing on results. Solid technical writing, presentation, and communication skills. Perks and Benefits     The position will pay quite well - Rs.12-18 lakh per annum is the band, and the final amount may be even higher depending on your experience and expertise. If made an offer, you will need to join in 4 weeks. This is the opportunity of a lifetime for people looking to specialize in highly coveted niche futuristic skills, and to work in a top multinational company with excellent employee-first initiatives. We look forward to your application.

column2: Educational Qualifications: Graduate Mechanical Engineers with about 8 - 20 years of experience in Oil and Gas sectors, Refineries and petrochemical units.  Areas of Experience:  The candidate shall have knowledge in defining and selection of packages like Glycol Dehydration system, Produced Water Treatment unit, Fired Heaters etcetera and Material Handling systems like Pedestal Cranes etcetera; should be conversant with ASME, API and other international codes, standards and specifications; should be able to prepare data sheets and RFQ documents, discuss with vendors, do technical analysis and review all vendor documents; should posses multidisciplinary concept. Experience in design of mechanical static equipment will be an added advantage. Engineers from EPIC contractors / Consultants preferred
column11: Water, Engineering, Produced, Oil, Treatment, and, Mechanical, Refineries, Gas, packages, petrochemical

column2: GENERAL STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES : The position is responsible for preparing Techno-Commercial Proposals for Equipment & Project enquiries along with preparation of Pre Bid/Post Bid documentation . The position would be the backbone for the Sales team and also the execution team. Position: Proposal Engineer Location: Hyderabad Industry : Water and Waste water (STP & ETP) Package Offered: Best in the Industry.  Experience: Minimum 2 Year in Proposal/Process/Plant Design  Academic background: PhD/MSc/BE/B-Tech/ME/MTech/MS(Chemical/Environmental/Biotechnology) Roles & Responsibilities   Expert in designing ETP/STP with conventional ASP and advanced activated sludge process like Extended Aeration , MBBR/IFASS/MBR/ SBR, A2O Process, MLE Process.   Preparing Process/ Unit Sizing Calculations, Hydraulic Flow Calculations, mass balance, basis report, process description, power schedules, power & chemical guarantees , costing sheet etc..   Preparing Mechanical equipment list, Electrical Load list & Bill of quantities.  Involved as a lead process engineer for handling the proposal by interacting with end User and sales force.  Preparation of Pre-Bid & Post Bid documentation and getting approvals though direct interaction with Project Consultants/Department  Having knowledge on Mechanical Screens/Aeration Equipment/Disc Filters /IFAS media/BFP/Sludge Handling Systems.  Provide Technical Guidance for technical Presentations/Discussions & Conduct Audits to O&M Sites and provide process guidance whenever required.   Interested candidates can share CVs to hr1@euroteckindia.com or whatsapp at 7995111978
column11: Proposal Engineering, Product Costing, Detail Engineering, Proposal Preparation, Process Calculation, Process Equipment, Proposal Management, Waste Water Treatment, Cost Estimation, Proposals, Techno-commercial, Technical Specifications
